title: Carlos Coronado - Sunset
description:
Guitarra: Carlos Coronado 
Imagen: Ignasi Roqué 
Percusión: Álvaro Coronado 
Bajo: Enric Bassacoma 
Edición: Ignasi Roqué 

Guitarra: Carlos Coronado 
Imatge: Ignasi Roqué 
Percussió: Álvaro Coronado 
Baix: Enric Bassacoma 
Edició: Ignasi Roqué 

Carlos Coronado - Sol: https://youtu.be/FxqT6UAKnoY

"Hoy aprecié una estupenda puesta de sol. Interpreté aquello como la interacción entre la naturaleza y el hombre. Un proceso comunicativo en el que el hombre destapa su condición egoísta y la naturaleza desprende bondadosa generosidad. Esta, dispuesta a ofrecernos esos bonitos momentos, y el desagradecido humano viéndolos cuando le place sin brindarle nada a cambio. Esto hace percatarnos del favor de la naturaleza al hombre, quien no tiene más remedio que subordinarse a ella."

#CarlosCoronado #MusicVideo #Rock #Sunset #Sol #Timelapse #Palafrugell #Empordanet #Girona #Catalunya

title: Opening a Haunt in the Covid Era
description:
In this video, we speak to Charles Rosenay, the founder of Fright Haven, Connecticut's largest indoor haunted house! We discusses the challenges of opening a haunted attraction during the COVID-19 era and talks about how this may impact haunts going forward. 

Fright Haven opens up in Stratford, CT on Friday, September 12th! Check them out at FrightHaven.com!

title: Shot choice and Perspective to create TENSION in An Empty House
description:
I figured I'd talk about some of the creative decisions that went into my last short film, "An Empty House". 

Shot Choice is arguably the most important factor when making the film, but I still haven't talked about Sound, Lighting and Performance. I might end up talking about them tonight on the Film Prompt Society Live Stream.

My Film: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sXiRd7Nz7aQ
Film Prompt Society: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCEBil7oBFbgProb_t2w2X0A 

Also, yes, I know. I did a terrible job of balancing the camera in the video blog section. It won't happen again.

title: When she's elder to you | Imperfect Match | Arrange marriage meet
description:
Welcome to  @SocialFootage  ..Here we present out new creation "Imperfect Match"  Story about an arranged marriage meeting conversation

*35 years old Sakshi unknowingly ends up meeting 30 yr old Mahi over a coffee for a marriage proposal. Sakshi who is sensible, serious and organised finds it difficult to gel with a carefree, funny and casual Mahi. This ‘not going to work out’ date turns out to be a perfectly ‘Imperfect Match’!*

We hope you will enjoy it.. Do Like, Comment, Share and dont forget to subscribe to our channel for more such original content...

#shorts #shortfilm #romanticfilms #romanticshortstories #romcom #romcomdrama #hindifilm #shorthindifilm #hindishortfilm2023 #shortfilm2023 #arrangedmarriage #datingstories #collegeromance #seniorjunior #arrangedmarriagemeetingconversation #arrangedmarriagemeetinggirlfirsttime

title: The Last Halloween
description:
Subscribe and enjoy more horror on SCREAMFEST https://bit.ly/2MYvdFt
The city is quiet; the streets, deserted. It doesn’t much feel like Halloween, and yet four young trick-or-treaters – a Ghost, a Devil, a Grim Reaper and a Witch – make their way through the night, door to door and house by house, gathering up an unlikely harvest of kindness amid the devastated wreckage of society’s collapse. In a world where the only rule is that there are no rules anymore, it is perhaps a fitting irony that it should all come down to this… a simple choice between two starkly different options. The Last Halloween is here at last, and the time has come to make your choice. So, what will it be? Trick? Or treat? - See more at: http://screamfestla.com/film/last-halloween#sthash.E9ExzQVF.dpuf
#shorts #shorts
#Screamfest #horror

Harms Way and Upwall Pictures presents "Celestial Bodies", a 9:16 comedy about climate change.

When Terra 🌍 catches humanity, she is watched over by her friends Luna 🌙 and Solana ☀️ 

Written and Directed by Hendrik Harms, "Celestial Bodies" stars Penny Ashmore, Maddie O'Brien and Sara Masry with music by Joss Gallanagh-Edwards.

title: Monstro!
description:

title: A man faces judgement day on how he will spend eternity. | Short Film "Crowtown: Rolling Sixes"
description:
SUBSCRIBE ► to watch the best short films: https://www.youtube.com/TheShortsNetwork?sub_confirmation=1

*Remember to CLICK THE BELL ICON so you can get notifications when the next video is released!

The world’s best short films from OSCAR® & BAFTA qualifying film festivals.

Short Film: Crowtown: Rolling Sixes
Directed by: Mark Kozlowski
Written by: Tony Lee
Cast: Leon Annor, Tremayne Miller, Thomas Thoroe

Everyone knows the rules. When you die, you get a key. And, after you walk through Purgatory, up to the Pearly Gates and place it into the lock, you'll go up to Heaven - or fall, burning into Hell. But over time a third choice has appeared - to stay in Purgatory - and across millennia the city of Crowtown was born. In a city like no other, filled with both the best and worst of humanity, Detective Gravel works the city beat - but when a stranger arrives, Cain, son of Abel, the creator of murder and the only man here who hasn't died, it can only mean trouble - trouble that Gravel needs to learn about in an interrogation. But what happens when the interrogator becomes interrogated?

ABOUT 
We showcase the world’s best short films from prestigious film festivals. Now you can watch these films and more on our YouTube channel, THE SHORTS NETWORK.

THE SHORTS NETWORK features short films from film festivals accredited by the OSCARS®, Academy of Motion Pictures Arts & Sciences,  BAFTA, British Academy of Film and Television Arts, and the CANADIAN SCREEN AWARDS presented by the Academy of Canadian Cinema and Television.

title: Reveries | Traditionally, music is written for film. Reveries is a film written for music.
description:
Reveries is a bespoke music film created to accompany the sweeping & elegiac orchestral works of composers Tristan Seewer and Bartosch McCarthy.

In Reveries, their compositions, "A Bout De Souffle" and "Zeigarnik" respectively, are linked together into a singular quasi-narrative effort, exploring the timeless themes of betrayal and forgiveness through the lens of interpretive dance and abstract visual storytelling.

In most cases, music is written to accompany a film, but Reveries is a film written for music.

'Reveries' is an experimental music video directed by @justinsuttles1048 

#FilmShortage #Composer #InterpretiveDance

title: A Short Film made with the Midjourney Bot, Adobe Photoshop and Premiere | The Nun (Experimental)
description:
Fast paced travel through the simultaneous imaginations of the filmmaker and his collaborator AI.

The NUN is a fast paced journey from representation to the abstract; from darkness to light; from dark emotion to joy. It’s what happens when you seek authentic imagery in a medium that urges sameness and easy meaning. For me it sits on the first rung of the filmmaking ladder with its focus on the essential elements of cinema … frame, shape, color and movement… all in service of a basic an emotional response that comes without manipulation from the filmmaker.  Made with the Midjourney Bot, Adobe Photoshop and Premiere.

title: A cringe-comedy about saying who you are (and sometimes failing to) / An Opening
description:
When Rachel, a neurotic aspiring artist, discovers her new friend is a prominent curator, she becomes obsessed with exploiting the connection.

A Film Shortage Selection + Best Picks of the Month (September 2022)
Subscribe for Your Daily Dose of Inspiration   @FilmShortage 
Or Inspire Others by Submitting Your film: https://filmshortage.com/submit/ 

'An Opening' a short comedy by Collin Davis
https://filmshortage.com/dailyshortpicks/an-opening/

From the creators:

"To be an artist, all you need to do is say you’re one. It’s like a magic trick. Sure you should also probably make some art, but the harder thing really is just to say it—at least for us. We set out to make a film that explored the insecurity of claiming our own self image - the despair we felt making claims at who we are. An artist. A filmmaker. An Actor. A writer. A director. 

We hope AN OPENING—a short that explores this difficulty for Rachel, an aspiring ceramicist who has trouble saying what she does—will make you laugh, too, and cringe, and remind you that sometimes the easiest things in theory are the hardest in practice. Sometimes our biggest obstacles are ourselves."

#FilmShortage #Comedy #Artist

Click here to watch more videos...........!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

► New Uploaded Bengali Movies: https://goo.gl/EMbM7S 
► Old Bengali Movie Songs : https://goo.gl/2SLfnj 

Synopsis::
‘Teesta Parer Kainya’ is the love story of Udasu and Kusum. Kusum is an orphan who gets love and a family after marrying Udasu. But Nurul Miaan and his friend Madhav ruin their lives. Nurul and Madhav always had an eye on beautiful Kusum but she rejected their advances. During an ugly spat Udasu stabs a fellow villager. He runs away and goes into hiding to escape from the police. Nurul finds out where he is and gets him murdered. Kusum keeps wandering madly after Udasu’s death. The panchayat helps the police to arrest Madhav for molesting a woman. Kusum kills Nurul to avenge her husband’s death and then commits suicide. Kusum and Udasu’s spirit are still found wandering in the Teesta valley.

title: Fear Clinic
description:
Subscribe and enjoy more horror on SCREAMFEST https://bit.ly/2MYvdFt
Five desperate patients return to the "Fear Clinic" when their trauma induced phobias that were caused by the same tragic shooting massacre inexplicably stricken them again. Desperate for answers, Sara (FIONA DOURIF) seeks out Dr. Andover to treat them again with his Fear Chamber -- a radical form of exposure therapy that manifests and controls their worst fears in the form of scary hallucinations. But what they encounter is something much more terrifying than their worst fears combined.

See more at: http://screamfestla.com/film/fear-clinic#sthash.aZX5hO6p.dpuf

A FILM SHORTAGE SELECTION

https://filmshortage.com/shorts/box-on-the-hill/

More from the director:
"I’ve always been fascinated by the idea of shame as a monster.
Shame has defined a good portion of my life. Not anxiety or depression, just a feeling that “I am inherently defective.” What I love most about movies and filmmaking is the chance to explore these emotions and feelings in extreme circumstances."

title: Relationship Advice | Secret to a Happy Marriage
description:
#relationshipadvice #bestmarriageadvice #relationshipgoals
**🎬 Welcome to Social Footage! 🎬**

We’re excited to present our new video, *Relationship Advice*! 💑✨

Marriage is often seen as a union between two individuals, much like a contract. In this engaging video, two friends have an enlightening conversation about the secrets to a happily married life. One friend shares valuable relationship advice, offering insights and tips that can make a real difference in any relationship.

Watch till the end to catch all the wisdom and practical advice on maintaining a joyful and harmonious partnership. If you find the video helpful and entertaining, please **share**, **comment**, and **subscribe** to Social Footage for more insightful and fun content!

🔔 **Subscribe** to Social Footage and hit the **bell icon** to stay updated on our latest releases!

title: 3 Easy Techniques for Beginner filmmakers
description:
I am once again making youtube videos about structure! It's fun getting back into the swing of it, and I hope I'm not retreading too much ground from videos like my How To Make a Micro Short Film video, but I think a lot of this is valuable in it's own right! This isn't so much a "How to structure a short film" as it is "A small handful of things to keep in mind when making a short film". Let me know if it's useful, and let me know if it's not! 

Looking forward to releasing plenty more videos in the coming months. 

#Film #Filmmaking #ShortFilm

My short films: 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tGjcKAN8nnM&list=PLgk9bAqToqq_c7Lwo3nWjGTvcg2tkLfX7

title: Just because she's living all alone doesn't mean she's not in loving company | Ghosted (Suspense)
description:
It's 2020 and we're in lockdown. A global pandemic has forced us to stay indoors. During this unforeseeable time, a single woman working remotely from home is perplexed by the mysterious texts, eerie sounds and faucets turning on and off around her house. She is mystified by the supernatural occurrences, but doesn't appear to be surprised to find out that she isn't the only one residing in her house, and hasn't been for some time.

title: Prelude / Film Shortage Top 10 Short Film
description:
Alex shares distressing thoughts about life to a girl he is smitten with, Marion; his ideas reveal the greater truth of their birth

A Film Shortage Selection
Subscribe for Your Daily Dose of Inspiration 
Or Inspire Others by Submitting Your film: https://filmshortage.com/submit/ 

Prelude - a sci-fi romance short by Tsubasa Matsumoto
https://filmshortage.com/shorts/prelude/
Top 10 2021 Selection https://filmshortage.com/top-10-short-films-of-2021/

Film Shortage on Social Media
Instagram: https://instagram.com/filmshortage
Twitter: https://twitter.com/filmshortage
Facebook: https://facebook.com/filmshortage
Website: https://filmshortage.com

PRELUDE a short romance drama, is the personification of a sperm falling in love with an egg. Through a series of character vignettes and global imagery, micro and macro blend into a beautiful metaphor of our struggle, similarities, and interconnectedness as a human race. So much to unravel in Tsubasa Matsumoto latest film, but told in a delicate manner where the metaphors wonderfully sweep in to tell the story in their own way. We’ve picked Tsubasa’s brain to tell us a little more on the making and intentions behind the film:

"The co-writer, and my childhood friend Koji remembered a story our middle school teacher told us: there were at least 3 people thinking the same thing we did and doing the same thing we did at any given moment in time. But, we believed interacting with other people makes you special. So, we wanted to make a film about everyone’s first interaction— a sperm falling in love with an egg. That’s how we came up with the initial concept."

Read the full interview with director Tsubasa Matsumoto: https://filmshortage.com/shorts/prelude/

#FilmShortage #SciFi #Personification

Prelude / Film Shortage Top 10 Short Film

title: A struggling actress/teacher takes career advice from her students. Short Film "Optimistic Realist"
description:
SUBSCRIBE ► to watch the best short films: https://www.youtube.com/TheShortsNetwork?sub_confirmation=1

*Remember to CLICK THE BELL ICON so you can get notifications when the next video is released!

The world’s best short films from OSCAR® & BAFTA qualifying film festivals. 

Short Film: Optimistic Realist
Written and Directed by: Brandon Ravet
Produced by: Caity Ware, Brandon Ravet, Sigi Ravet
Cast: Sigi Ravet

A struggling actress/Hebrew school teacher seeks career advice from her sage 5th-grade students.

Avigail is an optimistic, aspiring actress who currently teaches at a local elementary. Her story, 
an entire embodiment of an audition, features her 5th-grade students who hear her out while 
she seeks advice. One of her dear students plays the producer role as her family owns a major 
company and evaluates her teacher’s performance. Avigail tries to forge her own path as an 
actress while trying to win a leading production for an original story. Full of purpose and 
determination, she comes up with the biggest of inspirations thanks to her sister: to recreate 
and make known grandma’s story with a strong Jewish family legacy. 

Her spontaneous and childlike perspective gives her a brand new encouraged and optimistic 
position, promising her success with hard work. While her students assure and guide her 
through her own “La La Land” process, we pry into its credibility just as we fight both Avigail’s 
opposing forces: her optimism versus reality. After writing up her tear-jerking script, the eager 
actress makes it through the winning stage where, ironically, she now must audition for her own 
story to become the main character. 

When everything is against her, worried about her competitors, comparing herself to 
other’s Instagram followers, popularity, and age, Avigail even gets doubtful about her own
talent and opportunity, while all seems lost against the bottom line of the industry she desires 
to be in. Proving the crude reality, someone else gets the role she created. Avigail realizes her original story will not be what she intended to be, no matter how much effort she had put into it. 
Embracing her unexpected outcome, she understands the real deal, and as a result of great 
performances and direction, we understand this lively short film represents perfectly the irony 
of an entire industry.

ABOUT 
We showcase the world’s best short films from prestigious film festivals. Now you can watch these films and more on our YouTube channel, THE SHORTS NETWORK.

THE SHORTS NETWORK features short films from film festivals accredited by the OSCARS®, Academy of Motion Pictures Arts & Sciences,  BAFTA, British Academy of Film and Television Arts, and the CANADIAN SCREEN AWARDS presented by the Academy of Canadian Cinema and Television.
 
FOLLOW

Twitter https://twitter.com/ShortsNetwork

Note - Short film used with permission from filmmaker.

title: A captivating tale of unlikely bonds formed in the desert | North Country (Drama)
description:
A 1960s drama in beautiful black and white cinemascope, NORTH COUNTRY centers on a young woman found wandering the desert by an older man who takes her back to his isolated ranch. Over the days they wait for her parents to come pick her up, the uncertainty and barriers between them come down and they develop a complicated, platonic relationship that will impact their lives forever.

A subtextual, tone-poem of a short film in the style of Ernest Hemingway or Cormac McCarthy.

SUBSCRIBE for Your Daily Dose of Inspiration  ➠ @FilmShortage 
SUBMIT your film  ➠  https://filmshortage.com/submit/ 

A FILM SHORTAGE SELECTION

'North Country' is a black and white short film by Christian Walsh
https://filmshortage.com/dailyshortpicks/north-country-christian-walsh/

More from the director:
"There is a lot of pressure on a student filmmaker when making their thesis project. Numerous authorities and influences are pulling you in each and every direction to make something unique yet commercial, bold yet universal… something that will set you apart from all the other dreamer filmmakers out there.

I struggled to figure out what that film would be for me, and thought maybe I found it — then COVID hit. Like millions of others, my life (and project) was turned upside down. I took it as a sign – forget what everyone else says and wants and expects from my thesis. I was going to make something I *felt*.

NORTH COUNTRY is that film. It is not conventional, certainly not commercial. But it is uniquely me. In place of easily digestible themes are messages of intangibles, emotions that I have only ever felt but never been able to describe. It’s a film that I allowed to come out of me, rather than force into existence.

I don’t know exactly where the film came from beyond images and feelings in my head and heart that I wasn’t able to shake. I took inspiration from everywhere – authors like Ernest Hemingway and Cormac McCarthy, photographers like Fan Ho and Roy Decarava, painters like Andrew Wyeth, filmmakers like David Lowery and Yoshijiro Ozu. And many others.

This project faced the many challenges of being shot during COVID, battles with my university over length/structure/color, having half the money/crew/days we really need to shoot (in 113 degree Victorville heat, at the ranch MANK was shot and Citizen Kane was written). Was it all worth it? I hope so. In my heart I know so, because no matter what anyone else thinks or says, this is the film I’m most proud of and I couldn’t be more excited to share it with the world."

#FilmShortage #NorthCountry #ShortFilm

title: CGI VFX Spot :  "Launch"  by - Julian Ford
description: This is a great looking VFX spot his commercial was a lot of fun to make because the contrast was so great between the shot plates and the finished product. Everybody in the building was pulled together for three weeks (10days of comp) to focus of making this spot as good as possible in spite of the ridiculous time constraints. From the high quality matte painting in the first shot, through the CG stadium in the other shots and using flame particles and shot elements to integrate the scenes, we were quite happy with the finished product.

title: CGI VFX Spot :  "Hauert"  by -  boutiq
description:
Here is a really well done spot where a realistic CG squirrel performd in a live action environment. The timings and actions of the animal were blocked out by the boutiq team during pre-vis. 

After analyzing reams of squirrel footage to understand how these creatures moved, their animators lovingly key framed the squirrel into life. Various simulations were created to add realistic fur (over 6 million hairs) and muscle movements to the animation. Shot on location they added lots of 3D plant extensions during post production to simulate seemless interaction between the squirrel and the environment. 

Their goal was to make a humorous spot, and make the film look as believable as possible, since the squirrel and the "exploding" flowers our entirely computer generated and we think they succeeded!.

Credits:

title: CGI VFX Breakdowns: "Kerry Low Spot" - by MPC
description:
MPC creating the fully CG mouse and 50,000 traps.  MPC"s proprietary tools played a vital role on the successful development on the spot and the Nuke Compositing system brought it all together.

Website - http://www.moving-picture.com/
Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/Moving.Picture.Company
Twitter - https://twitter.com/mpc_vfx

About MPC

They are a creative studio. They craft spectacular visual experiences in any space, on any screen.

They have been one of the global leaders in VFX for over 25 years and counting, with industry-leading facilities in London, Vancouver, Los Angeles, New York and Bangalore.

Renowned for adding visual wonder and creative expertise to the advertising, film and entertainment industries, some of their most famous projects include blockbuster movies such as the Harry Potter franchise, Pirates of the Caribbean: On Stranger Tides, Prometheus and Life of Pi, and famous advertising campaigns for brands such as Evian, Cadbury, Sony, Coca Cola and John Lewis.

Their broad range of skill-sets provide a multitude of creative solutions, including concept design, pre-viz, shoot supervision, 2D compositing, 3D/CG effects, animation, motion design, software development, colour grading for advertising and any combination of these services.

MPC is the sum of the parts: creative partners and a range of creative solutions harnessed through a dedication to collaboration. It all comes together in our enthusiastic and talented people, working every day to be a part of creating some of the best and most inspirational work in the industry.

Synopsis::
‘Teesta Parer Kainya’ is the love story of Udasu and Kusum. Kusum is an orphan who gets love and a family after marrying Udasu. But Nurul Miaan and his friend Madhav ruin their lives. Nurul and Madhav always had an eye on beautiful Kusum but she rejected their advances. During an ugly spat Udasu stabs a fellow villager. He runs away and goes into hiding to escape from the police. Nurul finds out where he is and gets him murdered. Kusum keeps wandering madly after Udasu’s death. The panchayat helps the police to arrest Madhav for molesting a woman. Kusum kills Nurul to avenge her husband’s death and then commits suicide. Kusum and Udasu’s spirit are still found wandering in the Teesta valley.

Synopsis::
‘Teesta Parer Kainya’ is the love story of Udasu and Kusum. Kusum is an orphan who gets love and a family after marrying Udasu. But Nurul Miaan and his friend Madhav ruin their lives. Nurul and Madhav always had an eye on beautiful Kusum but she rejected their advances. During an ugly spat Udasu stabs a fellow villager. He runs away and goes into hiding to escape from the police. Nurul finds out where he is and gets him murdered. Kusum keeps wandering madly after Udasu’s death. The panchayat helps the police to arrest Madhav for molesting a woman. Kusum kills Nurul to avenge her husband’s death and then commits suicide. Kusum and Udasu’s spirit are still found wandering in the Teesta valley.

title: Science-Fiction drama "The Beast" - A Short Film by Rhoderyc C. Montgomery
description:
A chilling courtroom vignette set in the near future, this film is a science fiction drama starring Martha, an intelligent chimpanzee. 
A jury composed of six sets of identical twins witnesses the cross-examination of Martha, whose thoughts are verbalized through a
cranial computer implant. The film tackles such issues as the nature of the soul, humanity's responsibility toward other intelligent creatures and the ethics of the legal process.

This short film was nominated for the following awards:

- Palme d'Or - Best Short Film / Cannes Film Festival / France, 1995
- New Media Film Festival Award / New Media Film Festival / USA, 2010
- Commendation Award (won) / Festival of Fantastic Films / UK, 1999

title: On board a former freeze ship of the GDR | MS Stubnitz - Experimental Film by Nikki Schuster
description:
The MS Stubnitz is an 80 meters long historic vessel, built in 1964 at the Volkswerft Stralsund for the East-German fishing industries. From 1992 the MS Stubnitz was transformed into a moving platform for music, cultural production, documentation and communication and has visited 22 different ports across 11 European countries. Since 2014 the MS Stubnitz is moored in Hamburg. This film-portrait was animated within a 2 weeks residency on board in May 2015.

title: A little girl finds a way to connect to her late grandmother. | Short Film "Kintsugi"
description:
SUBSCRIBE ► to watch the best short films: https://www.youtube.com/TheShortsNetwork?sub_confirmation=1

*Remember to CLICK THE BELL ICON so you can get notifications when the next video is released!

The world’s best short films from OSCAR® & BAFTA qualifying film festivals. 

Short Film: Kintsugi
Written & Directed by: Jiayuan Liu
Produced by: Ryan Michael Connolly, Rachel Boyajian
Cast: Megan Liu, Juston Graber, Hana Wu, Xianlin Shan

A little girl finds an unexpected way to connect to the memory of her late grandmother, with the help of a mysterious friend.

Siyue, a young girl finds herself strongly attached to her late grandmother with whom she 
shares one of the biggest gifts; a handmade legacy she’ll learn and inherit. The 
delicate ceramic craft she learns, while spending heartwarming instants with her grandma, is 
broken off by her sudden death. Amongst everything left in her house, Siyue 
keeps the Xun, the vessel flute, the material connection left, the last artifact she taught and 
confectioned for her granddaughter. At granny’s home, Siyue faces strange, moving moments 
when returning to her old, rusty but hearty workshop, recalling her cozy memories from the 
past and connecting them to the present, lonely studio. 

Unexpectedly, she encounters a curious creature sneaking around the workshop. After 
overcoming the sudden jump scare, Siyue builds a wholesome friendship with her fellow, until, by accident, he breaks the girl’s flute. Disappointed and heavy-hearted, Siyue, with some help 
from the bizarre creature, tries to fix the Xun while she resembles her grandma’s footsteps from 
the past, in a sweet and nostalgic way, just to find out her beloved flute is not going to work as 
before. Now she needs a little additional help from her mysterious friend, traveling to her 
deepest and most touching memories while she understands better her feelings and overcomes 
them by having new, amusing experiences.

Kintsugi is a 15-minute short story that will embrace anyone having a deep, transcending 
relationship with a beloved, departed one. Her encounter with the mystical creature is just a 
reflection of her younger, joyful, lighthearted self from the past. Now, we see how Siyue is still 
learning, tried her best at fixing, and failed. We see how she’s growing up and now full of hope 
and acceptance she can enfold this part of life without losing her grandma’s wonderful 
connection.

DIRECTOR STATEMENT 
I have always believed in the power of imagination; how it can be shaped into action and make this world a better place. My family and I planned to celebrate my grandfather’s 80th birthday with him in the Chinese countryside. He passed away very suddenly, shortly before the celebration. I never got the chance to say goodbye to him. Kintsugi is a tribute to my grandfather. I believe the people we have loved in our lives never truly leave us; they continue to live on in our hearts and our memories. With Kintsugi, I want to tell a story of loss and change but also of hope and acceptance. I want to share this elegy through the innocence and wonderment of a young girl, Siyue, and the dynamism of film.

ABOUT 
We showcase the world’s best short films from prestigious film festivals. Now you can watch these films and more on our YouTube channel, THE SHORTS NETWORK.

THE SHORTS NETWORK features short films from film festivals accredited by the OSCARS®, Academy of Motion Pictures Arts & Sciences,  BAFTA, British Academy of Film and Television Arts, and the CANADIAN SCREEN AWARDS presented by the Academy of Canadian Cinema and Television.

title: La Mar Frustrada - Un curt planià d'Ignasi Roqué i Marc Agullé
description:
Un home de mar primitiu i el seu territori es veuen amenaçats per la presència d’un noi misteriós i granític. Tragicomèdia inspirada lliurement pel relat “Un Viatge Frustrat” de Josep Pla i per “Moby Dick” de Herman Melville.

Dirigit per Ignasi Roqué i Marc Agullé, amb Josep M. Alejandre i Ignasi Roqué com a repartiment. Guanyador del Premi Chico Marx als millors directors de menys de 25 anys del Festival Julius de Vic 2019 i participant del festival Off u22 de 2020. Rodat a Tamariu el setembre de 2019.

És ben bé que davant la mar, un sempre queda amb un pam de nas.


Un hombre de mar primitivo y su territorio se ven amenazados por la presencia de un chico misterioso y granítico. Tragicomedia inspirada libremente por el relato "Un Viaje Frustrado" de Josep Pla y por "Moby Dick" de Herman Melville.

Dirigido por Ignasi Roqué y Marc Agullé, con Josep M. Alejandre e Ignasi Roqué como a reparto. Ganador del Premio Chico Marx a los mejores directores de menos de 25 años del Festival Julius de Vic 2019 y participante del festival Off u22 de 2020. Rodado en Tamariu en septiembre de 2019.

Si es que ante la mar uno siempre se da de narices.


#JosepPla #HermanMelville #CostaBrava #Empordanet #Palafrugell #Tamariu #MobyDick #Cinema #ShortFilm #Girona #Catalunya #LaMarFrustrada

title: Short film on a disastrous first meeting with in-laws | "Premature" - by Gunhild Enger
description:
Pregnant woman meets her in-laws for the first time...

We follow the Norwegian Martin and his pregnant Spanish girlfriend, Lucia, during their first 15 minutes on Norwegian soil, observing Lucia’s first encounter with this new culture and her in‐laws. It’s a car trip full of social tensions, expectations and misunderstandings. Brilliant observational comedy done in one shot.

This short film won following awards:

- Jury Award / Leuven International Short Film Festival, 2012
- Brief Encounters Grand Prix / Encounters International Film Festival, 2012

Synopsis:::
‘Kaal Ratri’ is the story of a cursed night on which a poor man’s daughter Savitri is raped by local youths including the son of the school principal. The principal rescued the girl from his school, took her to the police and then got her admitted in the hospital. When Satya Bhushan finds out that his son is one of the culprits he gets a serious heart attack and is hospitalized. When he regains consciousness he tries to get the culprits punished. He keeps fighting despite the threats of the politician and his wife’s requests. But all his efforts prove to be futile when the victim withdraws the case and false medical reports are procured which prove that she was not raped. He resigns from the post of the principal after he is discharged from the hospital.

title: TRIGGERMAN | Omeleto Drama
description:
Two friends steal their car back.


TRIGGERMAN is used with permission from Tyler Holmes. Learn more at https://tyler-holmes.com.


Grayson and Vincent are two longtime friends. They're very different -- Grayson is neurotic and boyish, and Vincent is cynical and assertive. But when a junkyard owner takes Grayson's car and refuses to return it, the pair work together to steal it back.

But when Vincent gets a little too greedy during the heist, the plan goes awry. They get caught but manage to escape -- only for the situation to spiral even more out of control. Vincent and Grayson clash over the morality of their actions, pushing the friendship to the brink and each man to their breaking point.

Directed and written by Tyler Holmes, this taut, engaging crime thriller has a plot that's a classic riff on how seemingly small-stakes crime can escalate to something out of control. But it's also a portrait of an unbalanced friendship between two very different men and their diverging ideas of what's right and wrong.

Strikingly shot with gritty, shadowy visuals and dynamic hand-held camerawork, its style maximizes suspense and tension. But the storytelling also takes time and cares to emphasize character, making for a level of emotional engagement that can be unusual for the genre. It opens on the road, the two friends driving and chatting about the different music they like, though there's tension in the air. They drive into the desert in the darkness, but when they open the trunk of their car, it's clear they're fleeing something terrible.

The excellent script builds on both the crime and character aspects of the story, charting the steps to reclaim Grayson's car, as well as the fallout that follows each fateful decision. We see there's a rawness, hunger and drive to Vincent, but Grayson is more thoughtful and conscientious. In more relaxed circumstances, their contrasts might be intriguing to each other. But in a crime situation, they prove dangerous and even fatal. Vincent charges ahead, changing plans and objectives at his whim, while Grayson protests, even as fear pulls him along in complicity.

Actors Grant Hall and Cameron J. Ross as Grayson and Vincent, respectively, adroitly embody the differing energies and temperaments of the two men. In a different genre, they'd be an "odd couple." But as the story progresses and their heist escalates into violence, both begin to evaluate one another differently. Grayson sees Vincent not as take-charge and impulsive, but domineering and dangerous; Vincent, however, sees Grayson as a burden of weakness that he has to compensate for. He essentially questions Grayson's manhood -- and this final insult is what pushes the film to its raw, compelling conclusion.

With its hardboiled crime bona-fides and propulsive style, TRIGGERMAN appeals to fans of Michael Mann and other thriller auteurs, who like their action with panache and character. But it's also a thoughtful look at the fragile underpinnings of a friendship between two men, and how quickly it unravels when those underpinnings are challenged. High-pressure events and circumstances force their judgments of one another out into the open, and it's ugly and humiliating to witness. And the resulting shame forces them to stand their ground -- not against the world, but against one another.

title: What Are You Hiding? - One location Thriller short film (2022)
description:
What Are You Hiding is a short, one location thriller about a man who accidentally kills one of his best friends, and has to hide the body from another friend who has come to visit. 

Written, Directed and Edited by Matthew Gilpin (that's me!)
Produced by Ella Cumber

Starring:
Ella Cumber
Deri Evans
Dan Wyatt

Director of Photography- Benjamin Tate 
https://linktr.ee/TheBenDavies

Sound Designer - Cameron Naylor 
https://www.cameronnaylor.com/

Sound Recordist - Tom Codd
1st AD - Savannah Betts
Colour Grade - Mitch Corrigan

It was shot in Summer of 2021 (my god how time flies) on the Black Magic Pocket Cinema Camera.

#film #shortfilm #indiefilm 

If you'll permit me a little ramble, releasing this film a big deal for me in a lot of ways. It is the longest film I've ever made, and also the most I've ever struggled with a project in post production. The process of finishing this film was troubled to say the least, and very tied to my mental health. Whilst there are certain things about this film that I love, I'm also so glad to be able to cut it loose and move on to other things. I'm much too close to this film to be able to see it for what it is anymore, only what it means to me. It's nice thinking that it'l be out in the world, briefly touching people's lives, hopefully thrilling them for a few minutes, before they move on. The way it should be!

title: CGI Animated Short : "Child"s Play - Gift From Above"  by - Make
description:
CGI Animated Short: Child"s Play - Gift From Above by Makevisual for Childsplaycharity.org Child"s Play, is a game industry charity dedicated to improving the lives of children with toys and games in our network of over 70 hospitals worldwide. 

MakeVisual - MAKE is a design studio that specializes in the art of storytelling through motion graphics, visual effects, and animation.


More Info on Childsplaycharity.org: Since 2003, we"ve set up and organized Child"s Play, a game industry charity dedicated to improving the lives of children with toys and games in our network of over 70 hospitals worldwide. Over the years, you as a community have answered the call and come together to raise millions of dollars.

Child"s Play works in two ways. With the help of hospital staff, we set up gift wish lists full of video games, toys, books, and other fun stuff for kids. By clicking on a hospital location on our map, you can view that hospital"s wish list and send a gift.

Child"s Play also receives cash donations throughout the year. With those cash donations, we purchase new consoles, peripherals, games, and more for hospitals and therapy facilities. These donations allow for children to enjoy age-appropriate entertainment, interact with their peers, friends, and family, and can provide vital distraction from an otherwise generally unpleasant experience.

title: VFX Behind the Scenes Interviews: Sue Rowe, VFX Supervisor at Cinesite
description:
Another candid and insightful interview conducted by Vincent Frei, featuring Sue Rowe, CG Supervisor at Cinesite!  Some of her film credits include: "X-Men: The Last Stand", "John Carter", "Charlie and the Chocolate Factory", "Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time", "The Golden Compass".

Questions asked of Sue...
1. How did you start working in the industry?
2. You are one of a few women at the VFX Supervisor position. What are the advantages & Disadvantages?
3. In your opinion, what are the major changes in the industry since your beginnings and in London in particular?
4. What do you enjoy the most in your job?
5. What is your best work memory?

Special thanks for this video interview goes out to to Vincent Frei the creator of the fantatstic blog/website The Art of VFX (http://www.artofvfx.com), check it out now!

title: Noukadubi | Bangla Serial | Episode 12
description:
Watch Bengali TV Serial "Noukadubi" Written by "Kabiguru Rabindranth Tagore"

Synopsis :: 
Ramesh, after passing law, fall in love with modern Bramha girl Hemnalini. Failing to get Hemnalini's favour Akshay informed that to Ramesh's father. Hearing that Ramesh's father immediately gave marriage of Ramesh with a village girl. While returning after marriage by river, their boat drowned due to a heavy storm. When Ramesh got back his sense he found himself in the river bank besides his newly wedded wife. Ramesh could not see the face of his wife in the wedding night. But later he came to know that Kamala was also a newly wedded wife and their boat also drowned, but she was someone other's wife. Ramesh decided to find out Kamala's husband and hand over Kamala to him and then he would marry Hemnalini. So he admitted Kamala in the Calcutta Borading and got busy in finding Kamala's husband. Many days passed, Ramesh ultimately decided to marry Kamala. Kamala after not getting her husband, she wrote a letter to Hemnalini informing everything. Accidentally Kamala found that letter. Kamala secretly left for Kashi. In the mean time Hemnalini decided to marry Nalinaksha. Incidentally it was found that Nalinaksha was the actual husband of Kamala. To take revenge on Ramesh, Akshay went to Kashi in search of Kamala. But all his attempts were in vain. At last Kamala got back to her husband and Ramesh got Hemnalini as his wife.

Cast & Crew :--

Ramesh- Rishi Mukherjee
Kamala - Rupanjana Mitra

title: CGI FX Reel HD Important Looking Pirates 2014 | CGMeetup
description:
CGI FX Reel Important Looking Pirates 2014. Featured on http://www.cgmeetup.net/home/important-looking-pirates-fx-reel-2014/

Another great example of cutting edge VFX in this latest showreel featuring stunning work created by the talented artists over at ILP. ILP is a visual effects and digital animation studio located in central Stockholm. We can proudly say that we have assembled one of the best visual effects teams in the business. title: HOLD | Omeleto Drama
description:
A man sits in a parking lot.


HOLD is used with permission from Jonathan Blagrove. Learn more at https://holdshortfilm.co.uk.


Tommy is sitting in an empty parking lot in his car at night. He's ignoring calls, sets an alarm... and waits. He takes only one call at first: from his wife, who thinks he's at work at the office. He seems to be a man avoiding revealing the truth about his employment to his family.

But then Tommy is forced to answer a repeated caller, and soon more lies begin to unravel. And eventually, the deceptions intersect, leading Tommy to the precipice of a dangerous choice.

Written by Lynda Williams and directed by Jonathan Blagrove, this short thriller starts with an uneasy sense of stillness and quiet, with a seemingly simple setup of a man in a car. Deceptively calm, the atmosphere is one of killing time, with little action, dialogue or camera movement.

But as the film unfurls and precisely framed images lay out breadcrumbs, the few details begin to paint a suggestive picture. An alarm is set; messages are received; calls are ignored. The only phone call taken so far soon reveals enough backstory to fill in the character and the stakes. The storytelling is lean, efficient and admirably economical, slowly constructing a situation of lies, shame and deception. The fact that most of the information is relayed through dialogue and sound while still generating intrigue and tension speaks to the discipline and excellence of the writing and editing. Though the film takes place entirely inside a car, there's enough dynamism and conflict to hold and compel steady attention.

Soon viewers have enough to know what exactly is happening in Tommy's life, and more importantly, what's at stake for him if he succeeds or fails. This story momentum coincides with increased tension in the craftsmanship, from an amped-up score to more quickfire editing. Actor Robert Whitelock, too, ably captures the dawning realization of a man whose web of deception has been found out and whose world is slowly crumbling before his eyes. But in a brilliant juxtaposition, the outside pressure upon Tommy ramps us. And Tommy must react and choose quickly, making what is likely the most important and dangerous decision of his life.

HOLD then careens into a pulse-pounding climax, when the full rush of action and tension jets forward, pulling both Tommy and viewers into the unknown. It's all the more effective because it reflects Tommy's own emotional landscape, as the knot of mistakes covered up with deceit comes undone in a disastrous way. And it makes for a particularly emotionally immersive conclusion -- fitting for a powerfully controlled thriller that exhibits an unusual take on its genre, and covers immense ground in its short run-time.

title: Social media and technology in our lives | "Story" - by Jola Bańkowska
description:
"Story" is a reflection about modern man in an age of omnipresent technology. Looking through stories - a popular function in many social media platforms - we see people who are lonely, lost or already indifferent about reality surrounding them. Action takes place during one day and it's told by short, often (auto)ironic scenes, where virtual world sinks to reality. 

This short film was selected in the following festivals:
-69th Berlinale International Film Festival, Germany, 2019
-Annecy International Animation Film Festival 2019, France, 2019 
-25th International Short Film Festival in Drama, Greece, 2019
-14th ANIM'EST International Animation Film Festival, Romania, 2019 
-REX Animation Film Festival 2019, Sweden, 2019

-New York International Children's Film Festival, USA, 2020

-11th Roanne Animation Short Film Festival – Ciné court animé, France, 2020

title: ALY | Omeleto Drama
description:
A refugee goes to a party.


ALY is used with permission from Thomas Wood. Learn more at https://thomaswoodfilms.com.


Aly is a young asylum seeker in Paris. He arrived in Paris from Guinea and is waiting for his paperwork to go through the bureaucracy that is the French government. But in the meanwhile, life goes on, and after getting dressed and psyching himself up, he heads out to a party, where he hopes to impress Mathilde, the woman he has a crush on.

On the way, he waits in line for a meal being distributed to other refugees like him. But when he loses his place in line taking a phone call from his crush and gets into a scuffle with the police monitoring the crowd, he realizes that he can't easily escape the reality of his tenuous situation.

Written and directed by Thomas Wood, this short drama is a slice-of-life portrait of a young refugee in France, putting us in the shoes of someone who is an outsider and uncertain of his place in the social firmament. Aly is highly relatable, as a young man who wants to connect with a woman he fancies, and he's sweetly nervous about impressing her at a party later in the night. It's a hopeful romantic situation that many can relate to, and the film's visual naturalism with its handheld camera and offhand editing style gives us the sense of an ordinary life unfurling before our eyes. But the storytelling is alert to how someone's political and social realities -- often invisible to the outside eye -- can set Aly apart emotionally and culturally.

The film resonates with a quiet but powerful authenticity, both in the matter-of-fact documentary-like style and in its casting of lead actor Mamadou Diallo, who the director met as a volunteer at a non-profit distributing food to refugees. Diallo plays Aly first and foremost as a young man with relatable aspirations and hopes -- as someone with a crush on someone and trying to take it to the next stage. He's likable and appealing, his first scenes possessing an endearing vulnerability and excitement.

But as he heads out into the night and stops by for his meal distribution, things feel immediately more dangerous as he waits in line with other anxious refugees. As a tense situation develops, Aly realizes that he isn't "just" a carefree young man flush with anticipation and possibility. He's someone struggling to establish himself in a new country, with an uncertain future and many obstacles to overcome -- someone that some are wary of or look down upon.

Diallo ably portrays how this realization chips away at Aly's confidence and hopefulness, even as he finally makes it to the party and receives a warm welcome from his crush and other partygoers. But despite the conviviality, Aly is an outsider in this society, not yet accepted. The final image of ALY is both simple and profound in how it captures the loneliness that befalls its title character, an isolation made all the more poignant for its social setting. Even when surrounded by friendly people, Aly is alone, without a solid foundation -- and the comfort of a safety net if he stumbles.

title: SAFEKEEPING | Omeleto Drama
description:
A teenager and her brother embark on a journey.


SAFEKEEPING is used with permission from David Yorke. Learn more at https://david-yorke.com.


Young teen Jessica and her kid brother Charlie are setting out on a journey. They leave behind a dark, unsettling home life and set out into the larger world with few belongings.

The countryside they travel through is idyllic, stretching out around them in a pastoral, seemingly peaceful expanse. Together, they make a stop at a place they once enjoyed in simpler, happier times. But all is not what it seems, both in the world and between the siblings, as they embark on a trip that will change their lives forever.

Written and directed by David Yorke, this short drama appears at first to be a tender portrait of a relationship between a sister and her young brother, imbued with the golden light and beauty of the countryside. Taking a maternal role with Charlie and likely for the entire family, Jessica shepherds her brother as they prepare to leave. At first, it seems like a lighthearted excursion, captured in lyrical camerawork and cinematography. But the silent, ominous figure of their mother lying in the living room is a prominent hint that their pair are fleeing a troubling situation.

The storytelling toggles between the tender-hearted sweetness of the siblings in the past as they play in the countryside and their murkier present. Their golden memories are carefree and visually bright; their present is dustier and darker in tone. Small details in the dialogue and sound -- from sirens and crying in the background to promises to protect Charlie from pain -- build up a mystery of a troubled milieu that Jessica and Charlie are fleeing. The film often exists in a lyrical register, but embedded in its style are hints of a more troubling story, tucked away in the background for perceptive viewers to discover.

Young actor Jodie Price offers a subtle, nuanced performance as Jessica, capturing both the joy of being a sister to Charlie and a weight that only gets heavier as the story goes on. She evokes a burden of troubled emotion, one she carefully hides from her brother. Through it all, Charlie -- played by young performer Charlie Price with charming guilelessness -- trusts Jessica above anything else, which makes the end of their journey together all the more heartbreaking.

The end of SAFEKEEPING, taken on its own, could feel shocking. But as the wider world of the film is revealed and Jessica's actions are given context, the narrative gives rise to questions of love, duty and morality. It also makes for fascinating viewing, especially given recent worldwide events when so many people had to make hard decisions about their loved ones or watch helplessly as they suffered. Through it all, love endures -- but the shape it takes can depend on the world around us, full of forces often beyond our control.

title: CG short film about a Berliner in the Alps | "Déjà-Moo" - by Stefan Mueller
description:
What do a hysterical mother, two paramedics and a crazy cow have in common? They guarantee chaos in the Alps, which could be so idyllic otherwise. Through an unfortunate series of accidents and misunderstandings a young man from Berlin ends up in hospital. A surreal nightmare begins which staggers from Kafkaesque to psychedelic.

This short film won the following awards:

- Animamundi – Rio de Janeiro: Best Short Film - Audience Award
- Animamundi – Sao Paulo: Best Short Film - Audience Award
- Stuttgart Festival for animated film: Cartoons for teens Award
- Hessian Film Awards: Best Short Film
- German Film Rating Comission: Exceptionally valuable
- Muestra de Cine International de Palencia: Best Short Film
- Shorts at moonlight: Audience Award
- 4th Kalat Nissa Film Festival: 1st Prize Best Sound-Design
- German Film Rating Comission: Short Film of the Month
- Animago Award: Jury's Prize Nomination
- Friedrich Wilhelm Murnau Award: Best Short Film
- Peer Raben Music Award: Best Komposition Nomination
- 5th Filums International Film Festival: Best Animation 11th Konstanzer Kurz.Film.Spiele: Audience Award

/////////////////////////

Subscribe for more shorts: https://goo.gl/39Zrzi

/////////////////////////

title: CGI VFX Breakdowns : Earth Day "Rethink Butts" by Psyop
description:
Check out this creative and compelling CGI Animated PSA, by the talented Team at  Psyop!  Psyop takes on Toxic Litter for Earth Day with The Butler Bros, Legacy and Leave No Trace. For information or questions about this video please visit the links below:

Website - http://www.psyop.tv/
Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/psyop
Twitter - https://twitter.com/psyop
Google+ - https://plus.google.com/u/0/116649465125248232341/posts
The Butler Bros - http://www.thebutlerbros.com/
Legacy for Health - http://www.legacyforhealth.org/
Leave No Trace - http://lnt.org/
Rethink Butts Campaign - http://www.legacyforhealth.org/our-issues/cigarettes-and-the-environment/help-us-stop-toxic-litter

 
Software Used
Modeling and animation for the PSA was completed in Maya, while all the liquid effects were simulated using RealFlow.  The spot was rendered using Arnold in Maya, and compositing was carried out in Nuke and Flame.

Psyop partnered with The Butler Bros to develop a new set of Public Service Announcements (PSAs) for Legacy and Leave No Trace. The "Rethink Butts" campaign, which kicked off in an exclusive with the New York Times, aims to raise awareness, spark discussions, and encourage the general public to think about tobacco trash in a new way. 
In the spot, the camera pans from left to right, zeroing in on what seems to be toxic waste gushing from a run down factory. Nearing the end of the building, the camera  elevates and reveals not an industrial plant but a discarded cigarette butt, swimming in the gutter along with many others. The camera looks down from a bird"s eye view as the collection of butts leak chemicals into the water supply.

"Despite the fact that so many Americans are hyper-concerned about the environment and are eager to recycle household items and pick up litter, there remains a total disconnect when it comes to flicking cigarette butts onto our streets and into our waterways," explains Dr. Cheryl Healton, DrPH, President and CEO of Legacy. The campaign urges viewers to "Rethink Butts" and take a new perspective on this environmental issue.

"We set out to reposition cigarette butts from merely an unsightly form of litter to what they actually are — toxic waste," said Butler Brothers Director of Creativity, Marty Butler. 
Psyop drew inspiration from a variety of ecological disasters, including the recent toxic sludge tsunami in Hungary, as well as abandoned oil rigs and factories.
"From the initial pitch style frames, we increased the scale of the factory by five times,"  commented Psyop Creative Director, David Chontos. "This increased the level of detail across the entire design, which led to a tremendous amount of additional texture painting and modeling."

Credits
Client/Company: Legacy
Project Title: Rethink Butts
  
Agency: The Butler Bros
Creative Directors: Marty Butler / Adam Butler
Writers: Ronny Northrup / Adam Butler
Art Directors: Marty Butler / Ronny Northrup
Producer: Tim Willison
 
Director: Psyop
Executive Producer: Luisa Murray
Producer: Minh Ly
Creative Director: David Chontos
 
Designer: Lilit Hayrapetyan 
Matte Painter: Andrew Park
Lead Flame: Kim Stevenson
Compostior: Jonathan Iwata
3D Lead: Stephen Delalla
 
Modeler(s): Brianne Meyer / Kevin Manning / Danka Chiang
Animator: Victor Garza
Lighter(s): Stephen Delalla, Jonathan Iwata
GFX: Jason Mortimer
  
Sound Design Company: ESR Studios
Sound Designer: Eric Ryan

► Hottest Bengali Item Songs | Bengali Movie Video Songs : https://goo.gl/EGa2cR

Synopsis:::
‘Kaal Ratri’ is the story of a cursed night on which a poor man’s daughter Savitri is raped by local youths including the son of the school principal. The principal rescued the girl from his school, took her to the police and then got her admitted in the hospital. When Satya Bhushan finds out that his son is one of the culprits he gets a serious heart attack and is hospitalized. When he regains consciousness he tries to get the culprits punished. He keeps fighting despite the threats of the politician and his wife’s requests. But all his efforts prove to be futile when the victim withdraws the case and false medical reports are procured which prove that she was not raped. He resigns from the post of the principal after he is discharged from the hospital.

title: HALF | Omeleto Drama
description:
A young girl meets her half-sister.


HALF is used with permission from Flora Fei and Shin Ochiai. Learn more at https://offsfilms.com.


Jade is a shy, reserved 12-year-old girl heading to her grandmother's birthday dinner with her father. Jade's father and mother went through a rough separation, and as a result, Jade hasn't seen her father's side of the family for a very long time. So for Jade, this is a family reunion -- and also the first time she's meeting her younger half-sister Katrina.

The dinner is full of food and conversation, but Jade feels increasingly awkward and sad, conscious of how disconnected she is from this family. But when the dinner turns contentious at the mention of Jade's life with her mother, Jade realizes just how distant she is from her paternal relatives.

Directed and written by Flora Fei and Shin Ochiai, this intimate short family drama captures the painful feeling of being an outsider in one's own family. Jade says very little in the film, but her silence speaks volumes about the sadness, isolation and loneliness she experiences while meeting the estranged part of her family.

As a young, observant outsider in this half of her family, Jade has very little dialogue in the film. But the film is shot with a quiet, intimate naturalism that is attentive to Jade's reactions and emotions, capturing her subjective internal experience while also charting the casual togetherness of the family around her. As Jade sits alone, the family chit-chats and eats around her, but they often don't know what to say to Jade, who has faded into the background, even when she's physically there. The camera is the only presence interested in Jade, and sometimes even the visuals are distant and tentative, mirroring Jade's feeling of separation and marginality in the family.

Jade only comes into focus for her family when one member attempts to draw Jade out by asking about her life with her mother. But then the dynamic turns tense, hinting at the turbulent, dysfunctional conflict that led to Jade's estrangement from her father's family. Young performer Olivia Kaiser is quietly remarkable as Jade, able to convey both Jade's shy demeanor and her inner emotional turbulence. When the atmosphere turns pointedly bitter, it's too much for Jade to handle -- and she retreats in the only way she can.

Empathetic, delicately crafted and sensitive, HALF resonates in the end as a powerful snapshot of the toll that familial dysfunction takes on young children, who often have no voice or agency as they navigate rough emotional terrain. We never quite find out the circumstances of Jade's family history, but it's telling that we meet Jade after years of estrangement, and the film's achievement is how we feel the weight of that disconnection upon Jade after all that time. Children might not have the full language or understanding of a situation that's dysfunctional, but they can still observe and feel everything -- and carry it with them, no matter how much they've grown.

title: Ludwig Trepte in "Erledigung einer Sache" - Einem Kurzfilm von Dustin Loose
description:
Um dem letzten Willen seiner Mutter nachzukommen, muss Jakob Adler seinen leiblichen Vater aufsuchen, dem er noch nie zuvor begegnet ist. Denn sein Vater sitzt seit mehr als fünfundzwanzig Jahren in der geschlossenen Psychiatrie. Doch bevor es zu der schicksalhaften Begegnung kommt, möchte Jakob den behandelnden Arzt DR. Weiss konsultieren um ihm das wahre Ausmaß der Familientragödie zu offenbaren.

Dieser Kurzfilm gewann folgende Preise: 

- Audience Award / BAMBERGER KURZFILMTAGE, 2015
- Student Academy Award / Silver Medal, 2015
- Audience Award: Erster Gang / 25th KINOFEST LÜNEN (Competition, Germany), 2014
- Winner International Fiction / FRESH - THE STUDENT MEDIA FESTIVAL OF WALES, 2015
- Bamberger Reiter 25th Bamberger Kurzfilmtage, 2015
- Special Jury Award / HOUSTON INT'L FILM FESTIVAL, 2015
- Coup de coeur de Tyo  / 25th INTERNATIONAL STUDENT SHORT FILM FESTIVAL OF CERGY-PONTOISE, 2015
- First Prize / Audience Award / 11th KURZFILMFESTIVAL „FILMSALAT“, 2015
- Silver / 42nd STUDENT ACADEMY AWARDS, 2015
- First Prize of Jury / 8th FILMZEITKAUFBEUREN, 2015
- First Prize  / 3rd HAGENER KURZFILMFESTIVAL EAT MY SHORTS, 2015
- Best Screenplay / 11th EARLY BIRD STUDENT FILM FESTIVAL, 2015
- First Prize / 31st INTERNATIONAL SHORT FILM FESTIVAL BERLIN – INTERFILM, 2015

title: CGI Animated Behind The Scenes" "Rare Replay Making of" - by Realtime UK
description:
Check out this cool making of "Rare Replay" by the talented team at Realtime UK!  For more information, please see the details and links below:

How do you pack over thirty years of Gaming Excellence in just under two minutes?
Well, we were flattered (and daunted) when our good friends at Rare came to us with this exact challenge. They wanted us to create a short video that would capture the very best of their amazing achievements in Video Games.

It provided our team with a great opportunity to work on something that had a distinct visual style and is a slightly different approach to the style of work we’re usually known for. As ever, our team had a great time working on the piece, once again working collaboratively with one of the Games Industry’s longest surviving (and Best!) development teams in the World.

Director: Ian Jones
Client: Rare / Microsoft Studios

http://www.realtimeuk.com

Direct ticket link: https://bit.ly/2ybhxQ6

"It has been almost 34 years since one of the scariest horror characters of all time, Freddy Krueger (Robert Englund), invaded the dreams of a generation to exact his deadly form of revenge and murder. Now, Freddy has entered into the dreams of another master of evil -- the unstoppable Jason Voorhees (Ken Kirzinger) - plunging cinema's two greatest titans of terror into a battle to end all battles."

Cast: Robert Englund, Ken Kirzinger, Monica Keena, Jason Ritter, Kelly Rowland, Chris Marquette, Lochlyn Munro

A Q&A moderated by Brian Collins of Birth.Movies.Death. follows the screening. Tickets are $16.00 and include a complimentary beer for guests 21+.

Tickets are not refundable

Studio: New Line Cinema
Director: Ronny Yu
Screenwriter: Damian Shannon, Mark Swift
Genre: Action, Crime, Horror

Official Website: http://www.freddyvsjason.com

********************************************************************
Screamfest Horror Film Festival is America’s largest and longest running horror film festival. The festival runs for 10 days in October in Los Angeles.  Screamfest, has launched careers - providing a platform for filmmakers and actors to showcase their latest work to enthusiasts and general audiences. We are proud to show you some of the short films that have screened at the festival over the years.

Every week we upload a fantastic short horror film that has premiered in our festival for you. Horror fans please LIKE, SHARE, FAVORITE or EMBED our videos with your friends and support our talented filmmakers.

title: CGI & VFX Breakdown: "Skull & Bones" - by Goodbye Kansas | TheCGBros
description:
Check out this revealing Cinematic Breakdown for "Skull & Bones" - from the talented Goodbye Kansas. The cinematic trailer for Skull and Bones tells a ‘rags to riches’ story about the destitute character Sam, finding his way from the streets of Boston, overcoming adversities, and swashbuckling his way to become a pirate lord in the Indian Ocean.

In order to tell the story which spans oceans, continents, and time, Goodbye Kansas collaborated closely with DDB and Ubisoft Singapore to find the correct context, tone, and tempo of the narrative as well as flesh out and develop the protagonist: Sam.

The challenge was to show the hero’s journey, as well as hint at the larger scope of the game’s world and the possibilities it offers. For more information, please see the details and links below:

TEAM: 
Client: Ubisoft & DDB Paris

title: OUTSIDERS | Omeleto Drama
description:
A couple's visas expires.


OUTSIDERS is used with permission from Gleb Osatinski. Learn more at https://glebosatinskifilms.com.


Dmitry is a young immigrant father coming home with a crib for his infant daughter Dasha, lugging the furniture up the stairs to the cramped apartment he shares with his wife, Zhenya. All seems well until the crib breaks later that night, and the baby ends up with a bump on its head.

Zhenya wants to bring Dasha to the emergency room. But things are complicated because while Dasha was born in the U.S., Dmitry and Zhenya are immigrants whose visas have expired. They fear deportation and being separated as a family, but the safety of their baby daughter is also at stake.

Directed by Gleb Osatinski from a script co-written by Osatinski with Joshua Sonny Harris, this compelling short drama transposes an engaging chamber drama of family life upon the suspense of immigrants facing a dilemma made even more complicated and even dangerous by their uncertain legal status. There's an almost documentary-like closeness in the small gestures and moments of the family together, as handheld camerawork captures the tender touches, looks and seemingly throwaway dialogue of Dasha with her parents. The focus is on close-ups, and we don't see much of their home space. But from the shadows and framing, it feels cloistered and cramped.

When the family is content, this visual closeness feels almost cozy, and actors Yana Mulder and Dmitry Tagovitskiy as the parents have a palpable connection and understanding between them that feels equally lived-in and tender. The ensemble feels like a believable and relatable family: a set of new parents making a home together, even in difficult circumstances. But when Dasha's head gets bumped when the crib falls apart, this proximity between the camera and characters feels more like walls closing in on the family, mirroring how the family feels trapped by their circumstances, forcing them to make untenable choices at their most fearful and vulnerable.

Both parents are concerned for their daughter, but due to their status, Dmitry worries about the consequences of an ER visit that would rend the family apart. As Zhenya and Dmitry navigate the crisis, the beautifully subtle dialogue and performances come to the fore, as a formerly united couple faces a precipice and a decision. The future of the family is hazy, but viewers get a sense that the primary relationship between Dmitry and Zhenya has shifted. And whether or not the family's outer circumstances change, the inner emotional terrain between them has.

Thoughtful, somber and resonant, OUTSIDERS is a title that immediately frames the main characters as existing in a twilight zone outside a larger system. The film's gift is its ability to use a pared-down set of storytelling elements -- a small but specific set of characters, disciplined visual approach and highly focused, thoughtful narrative -- to capture both the intimate emotions and larger sociopolitical context, giving it a power that goes beyond its seemingly modest scale. We share the intimacy of a young family's togetherness in a lovely quicksilver stream of moments, emotions and sensations, which feel almost sacred in their hush -- but we also experience how the larger currents of the world can easily threaten to carry them away, sweeping over them like debris in a wide, dangerous sea.

title: CGI Animated Breakdowns : The Making of: "3eme Type" - by Yann Vlamynck
description:
Check out this insightful look at the making of the 3D CGI animated short film, "3eme Type" by the talented Yann Vlamynck, Jason Mertens, Charlotte Walle, Axel Vanhille, Thomas Burette et Jeremy Klemenski! For more information, please see the details below:

An Alien who just crashed in a human town is trying to create contact with a Geek teenager who"s a skateboard fan. The communication between them will not be simple ...

We wanted to tell a story in which we could associate narration, action and dynamic staging in a coloful, acid and fun universe !

title: 📽️ Vertical Short: "The Box" - by Dušan Kastelic | TheCGBros
description:
—————————————————————————————————————————————————— TheCGBros Presents a Vertical Short: "The Box" - by Dušan Kastelic - You have probably heard of the phrase "To think outside of the box"?  This is a film about such a box and the flat-headed creatures that live inside of it. Life inside the Box is boring and miserable. Until one day a new baby boy starts to grow in the middle of the Box! The boy is very different from other flat-headed inhabitants of the Box- he's happy, lively, and curious. As the boy grows bigger and bigger, the flat-headed neighbors are becoming more and more annoyed with him.  Until one day he grows literally over their heads...  #TheCGBros #CGI #Animated #shortfilms —————————————————————————————————————————————————— Watch the full film here ►: https://youtu.be/IBvcjjCEnus——————————————————————————————————————————————————————

title: CGI VFX Breakdowns : "Grand Theft Auto RISE" by Gevorg Karensky
description:
Check out this insightful VFX breakdown from the live action version of  the Grand Theft Auto video game series, by the talented Director and VFX Supervisor Gevorg Karensky!  For more information or specific questions about this video, please visit the links below:

Grand Theft Auto: RISE is about the birth of an underground hero. He is not the hero that we are used to seeing. He is submerged in his own internal darkness. He is a protagonist. People will fall, things will break, he will be left standing alone in a tunnel with no light at the end.

This is a different take on the live action version of the world famous Grand Theft Auto video game series created by Rockstar Games.

Watch the full film:
Grand Theft Auto: RISE - (Live Action Short Film)
YouTube: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=M94Bl06p9K4
Vimeo: https://vimeo.com/54471263

title: CGI 3D Animated Tech Short : "Liftport" - by DSEA Group
description:
Check out this terrific 3D Animated Tech Short that illustrates how the design of a Liftport device or "lunar elevator" might work to shuttle cargo and personnel from the Earth to the Moon!  For more information, please see the details and links below:

DSEA: https://www.facebook.com/DSEAgroup
GCU: http://www.gcu.ac.uk/
LiftPort: http://lunarelevator.com/
Stellardrone: https://www.facebook.com/stellardrone

DSEA is the group set up and run by engineers and scientists. They want to improve the current way STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics) outreach groups work. 

They folks at DSEA are trying to get everyone on board, not just scientists and engineers, but artists, writers, animators, teachers, and labourers as well, feeling everyone is a designer of something at heart.

They do not like the exclusive approach that has been taken for years and they want to work with all artists, people outside of traditional engineering and design fields. The future is for us all, not for the for the few!

Saying that, we even aim to get kids from poor countries / conflict zones interested in science and engineering. Here is a video (non animation) of one of those outreach projects, this was ran in Iraq, and is still running there, despite the conflict. 
Bare in mind we are a group of individuals running this, not a large company, just guys wanting to make a positive change.

title: Noukadubi | Bangla Serial | Episode 28
description:
Watch Bengali TV Serial "Noukadubi : নৌকাডুবি" Written by "Kabiguru Rabindranth Tagore"

Synopsis :: 
Ramesh, after passing law, fall in love with modern Bramha girl Hemnalini. Failing to get Hemnalini's favour Akshay informed that to Ramesh's father. Hearing that Ramesh's father immediately gave marriage of Ramesh with a village girl. While returning after marriage by river, their boat drowned due to a heavy storm. When Ramesh got back his sense he found himself in the river bank besides his newly wedded wife. Ramesh could not see the face of his wife in the wedding night. But later he came to know that Kamala was also a newly wedded wife and their boat also drowned, but she was someone other's wife. Ramesh decided to find out Kamala's husband and hand over Kamala to him and then he would marry Hemnalini. So he admitted Kamala in the Calcutta Borading and got busy in finding Kamala's husband. Many days passed, Ramesh ultimately decided to marry Kamala. Kamala after not getting her husband, she wrote a letter to Hemnalini informing everything. Accidentally Kamala found that letter. Kamala secretly left for Kashi. In the mean time Hemnalini decided to marry Nalinaksha. Incidentally it was found that Nalinaksha was the actual husband of Kamala. To take revenge on Ramesh, Akshay went to Kashi in search of Kamala. But all his attempts were in vain. At last Kamala got back to her husband and Ramesh got Hemnalini as his wife.

title: RealtimeUK Nuke Pipeline Demo by Matt Richardson | CGI 3D Tutorial HD | CGMeetup
description:
CGI 3D Tutorial RealtimeUK Nuke Pipeline Demo by Matt Richardson. Featured on http://www.cgmeetup.net/home/nuke-pipeline-demo-by-realtimeuk/

Matt Richardson from RealtimeUK: A demo of how to use the my Nuke pipeline, currently in use at RealtimeUK.
It’s essentially a whole load of python scripts that I have written over the past 4 years, that all work together to offer some of the functionality you get in Shotgun, Ftrack and NukeStudio.
Compositing is the creative process of assembling and combining filmed or rendered elements from multiple sources, to create a final lifelike illusion or fantastical visual effect, delivered as a set of still or moving pictures. There are two different types of compositing: node-based and layer-based.
NUKE is a node-based digital compositing application developed by The Foundry. www.realtimeuk.com

title: CGI 3D Breakdown HD "Making of Keys" by Raphael Rau/Silverwing and Simon Damborg | CGMeetup
description:
CGI 3D Breakdown, Making of Keys by Raphael Rau/Silverwing and Simon Damborg. Featured on http://www.cgmeetup.net/home/making-of-keys/

Keys final Short https://youtu.be/qTiObEm2bBs
Making of Keys https://youtu.be/rSFrI0hz-xg

A visual Experiment is a experimental short film by Silverwing aka Raphael Rau with the amazing help of composer and sound designer Simon Damborg. The aim of Keys is it to create a mix between the the known everyday environment and something strange and mysterious.

Tech specs:
Modeled, UV-unwrapped, simulated etc in Cinema 4D R18
Rendered with Octane Render 3
Color correction and postwork in Adobe After-Effects
Resolution Full HD 1920 x 1080 px / HD Cinemascope 1920 x 800 px / Stills 4K 4096 X 2160 px
Rendertime ranging from 3 Min (Lock Shot) to 60min (Pillar Shot) on one GTX 980 TI
The film was rendered using a cluster of 14 GPU´s
Raphael Rau / Silverwing http://www.silverwing-vfx.de/
Simon Damborg http://www.humanrobotsoul.com
