title: CGI & VFX Showreels: "Studio Reel" - by Industrial Motion Art
description:
Check out this awesome studio reel by the the talented team at Industrial Motion Art! For more information, please see the details and links below:

About
----------
Industrial Motion Art regards itself as a broad collective of a group of young people with different backgrounds and fields of experience, whose position in the creative world of Film and Television is mainly anchored in the Visual Effects and Digital Art-, but also in the Production domain. 

Three different headquarters strengthen Industrial Motion Arts stand an international studio which has garnered many prices for its digital production work, very recently the Gold World Medal in Science&Technology of the New York Festival for International Television & Film Awards in 2013. Instead of however presenting a long list of already won awards, what we consider an even more important issue is expressing our emphasis concerning our continuous pursuit to find new possibilities of co-operations not only in the scope Film and Television but also with other visual media forms, such as Graphic Novels or Avantgarde Installations. 

Furthermore we would like to highlight our various collaborations with renowned Universities, such as the University of Applied Arts in Vienna which aim to discover new levels and opportunities of connectivity between scientific data and visual graphics. 

Openness, a sense for potential and most significantly audacity and a willingness to confront risks are all characteristics which shape the self conception of Industrial Motion Art and fortify our uniqueness.

Links and Social Media:

title: CGI 3D Animated Short: "Samurai Frog Golf" - by Marza Animation Planet Inc. | TheCGBros
description:
TheCGBros Presents  "Samurai Frog Golf" - by Marza Animation Planet Inc. - Humans have vanished into whispered legend and animals have regained ownership of the land, sea and sky.  Our story is about one particular frog:

Scarred inside and out, the old samurai is haunted by ghosts of a life of violence in the Frog Wars. He melts his sword into a golf club and vows never to kill again.  A gruff, solitary creature, he wants nothing to do with any other living beast, and especially not his hated ancient enemies the Turtles.  All he wants is to be left alone to spend his remaining years at peace on the golf course.  

As fate would have it, one bad swing sets off a course of events that put him in the unwilling position of caring for a baby - but not just any baby, the infant prince of the turtle clan!  Pursued by enemies old and new, our hero must set off on a long and dangerous journey to return the baby to his homeland.  With his tamahage driver and his caddy, the sage but forgetful sugar-glider by his side, the trio travel across a vast and perilous land. Through the adventure, our hero must learn to overcome his own prejudice, forgive his ancient enemies and himself, and heal the wounds of the past.  If our hero is to reach his goal and find his own redemption, he must take this sage bit of advice from his caddy:

“To move forward, you must be like the turtle.  He only progresses when he sticks out his neck.” For more information, please see the details and links below:

title: CGI & VFX Breakdowns : "Ninja Turtles - Veterans of the Night (Homage)" - by Miguel Díaz-Rivera
description:
Check out the VFX Breakdown for The Ninja Turtles - Veterans of the Night (Homage)" by the talented Miguel Díaz-Rivera! This is his thesis project that he did at the Academy of Art University. He made an homage to the original comic book turtles. But wanted to create a realistic approach and not having them as teenagers. 

Synopsis:
40 years after the war against the Foot, a Japanese ninja clan. Four mysterious veterans are preparing themselves for the fight of their life.

This short film is a non-profit fan film and is not endorsed by or affiliated with Nickelodeon, Paramount Pictures or any of their parent companies or affiliates. All names and references are copyright and trademark of their respective holders. This film was for educational purposes only. The short film contains graphic violence and is intended for mature audiences only. Viewer discretion is advised.

title: CGI Animated Teasers : "Invasive Species" - by Sacha Austin
description:
Check out this intriguing teaser trailer "Invasive Species" by the talented Sacha Austin. After surviving for eons in the vast stellar vacuum. Now it has found a new home!! The crew of the International Space Station make an emergency landing after the planet has been overrun by an alien species. As the only conscious humans left, an astronaut and cosmonaut must find the system"s weakness... The teaser is for a film that will be crowd funded in the spring, so stay tuned! For more information, please see the details and links below:

Photogrammetry scans for the faces of the characters were used and then modeled and rigged them for animation. Everything was modeled and textured in 3ds max and Mudbox from NASA and ESA references, & rendered with Nvidia"s iRay.

http://www.sachaaustin.com/

title: CGI Animated Short Film "Legio XVII" by Jérémy Cisse | CGMeetup
description:
CGI 3D Animated Short Film: Legio XVII Short Film by Jérémy Cisse. Featured on http://www.cgmeetup.net/

The story was inspired by an historic battle of the ancient rome, when the germans clans join the rebellion organized by Arminius and push the Romans out of the germania. This roman army was the greatest army of this time, composed by three legion ( XVII, XVIII and XIX ). Arminius had an army much less important and yet, he decide to attack the biggest Roman army on the german territory. He attracted them into the forest and took them in ambush.

All three legions were destroyed in what is known as the Battle of Teutoburg Forest, After their destruction, the Romans never used these legion numbers (XVII, XVIII and XIX) again and never come back to Germania.

Germania, 9 ap. J.-C.

LEGIO XVII short film by Jérémy Cisse directed during 4th year at Supinfocom Valenciennes !
Music : Adèle Zalem - Didgeridoo Duet
Evelyn Glennie - Chase

JÉRÉMY CISSÉ http://jcisse8.wixsite.com/portfolio

title: Sci-Fi Podcast "Flight 008" | Episode 9 - Last: Seat 42E | DUST
description:
When Yumiko’s return trip from her mother’s funeral lands her 20 years in the future, she finds that in a sense, she is the one who’s been buried. But perhaps, if she’s lucky, she can find a way to unearth herself and reconnect with her long-lost daughter. 

"Last: Seat 42E" is written by William Shunn and performed by Sarah Drew

title: CGI & VFX Behind the Scenes "Smite ‘To Hell & Back’ PT1" - by RealtimeUK | TheCGBros
description:
Enjoy part 1 of this insightful behind the scenes for the CGI animated cinematic trailer "SMITE – To Hell & Back", by the talented team at RealtimeUK! For more info, please see the details and links below:

"To Hell and Back’ is the latest SMITE cinematic trailer produced for our client Hi-Rez Studios. Launched ahead of the 2016 ‘SMITE World Championships’ e-sports event, this latest trailer pits some of the game’s most iconic characters against one another in an epic and audacious battle.  "With this latest cinematic, the intention was to evoke emotion in our viewers and have the audience engage with each character. We take each character on a journey throughout the trailer, revealing multiple facets to their personalities, and creating iconic and memorable imagery. For us this trailer should be as fun as it is epic, something you can watch over and over and get something new each time. We are really proud of what we have achieved and we hope you enjoy it too"!

title: CGI Animated Shorts : "Freewill" - by Quentin Pontillart
description:
Check out the unique rendering style in this CGI Animated Short Film from the talented Quentin Pontillart! It"s about  wanting to express the need that some people have to free themselves from the path someone chose for them. And how hard it is to do so.  

The film was created in about 6 months for the Supinfocom School, by Quentin Alone. He wanted to focus on the rendering and compositing part. His goal was to give a painterly look to it and kinda erase the 3D feeling. 

Software: Mainly 3ds Max and Nuke, the textures and matte painting were done in Photoshop, editing in Avid. It was render using Scanline and V-Ray for volumetrics. 

Quentin Website -http:/orbi-folio.com/
Tumblr - http://www.orbiprod.tumblr.com/
Vimeo - https://www.vimeo.com/orbiprod

title: THE SHUTTLE | Omeleto Drama
description:
A woman suspects her husband is cheating.


THE SHUTTLE is used with permission from Lu Han. Learn more at https://vimeo.com/luhanfilm.


Nail salon owner Wenhua is dealing with miscarriage after miscarriage, unable to carry a child to term. Meanwhile her husband -- who shuttles the salon employees back and forth from their homes to their workplace -- may be sleeping with one of her younger employees, who has a secret of her own.

Writer-director Lu Han offers a piercing, intimate look at the emotional life of a couple who have come to the U.S. and established the foothold of a better life, but are struggling with the next step of building a family together.

The film is built on strong, sensitively calibrated performances, which often underplay the roiling emotions and situations the characters are dealing with. The approach celebrates the everyday interactions, glances, silences and gestures that actually build or destroy our relationships, turning what could be melodrama into a beautifully observed chamber piece.

When the film's main character suspects all is not right in the workplace she runs or the marriage she's trying to hold together, she has a choice to either turn to bitterness or grow towards compassion. Lead actor Alice Ko charts Wenhua's arc with precision, and the result in an honest journey into one woman's grappling with the truth and what that means for the life she and her husband have built for themselves in the U.S.

It also offers a window in the workings of a seemingly innocuous space that most Americans take for granted. Nail salons are everywhere, whether in the strip malls of suburbia or nestled on the corners of busy streets. They're tucked away and often busy, thanks to their cheap prices and quick service.

But Lu Han adds complexity to the picture, showing the hard work and behind-the-scenes struggles of the people who run them. Combined with the tense emotional drama deftly portrayed in the film, the salon becomes a pressure cooker: a trap, as well as an opportunity to progress in life.

The result is a film that's not just about one woman's shift in how she sees herself and her marriage, but a rich examination of what it means to be in a community and find emotional sustenance in it. At the film's end, nothing concrete is resolved -- but each character finds a different understanding of what it means to care and be responsible for one another.

title: 🏆Award Winning🏆 CGI Animated Short Film: "Hungry" (Hambriento) by Hungry Team  | TheCGBros

title: CGI VFX Spot 1080 : "Unleash The Beast"  by - Richard Lee
description:
Check out this spot created for Monster Energy drink by the talented Richard Lee shot by Chris Probst and a shooting crew made up predominantly of his students. Richard chipped away at the VFX shots himself slowly over a few months, building a spaceship set in his garage!

Shot on a Red Epic camera with Kowa anamorphic lenses at Trona Pinnacles, CA.

Special thanks to Chris Probst, Michael Angelos, Hayley Atkin, Stephanie Corneliussen, Reece Rios, Ken Mowe, Dave Hussey, Ranko Tadic, DNA and everyone else who volunteered.

title: CGI Official Trailer : "SEBASTIAN: The Slumberland Odyssey"
description:
In a peaceful world led by artificial intelligence, where disease is a choice and unmonitored dreaming is punishable by death, a young immigrant will risk his life by traveling into the Dreamworld in order to save his inexplicably ill grandfather. 

Synopsis: 
Sebastian: The Slumberland Odyssey is the first “Sci-Fan” tale to take the viewer on a mind-bending journey through worlds that have seldom being intertwined before. It’s a classic coming of age legend that takes place in two worlds. One world is the future where thanks to an incredibly advanced A.I., humanity has been able to overcome, war and poverty. Disease is now a choice and at last mankind has been united under a mission of collective prosperity… With one small price to pay: The loss of individuality. In order for humankind to unite, people have forgone their ability to dream and their desire to be different. With just cause, since unauthorized dreaming is now punishable by death.

The second world is beyond the reach of the A.I. : The Dreamverse.. or as it is known in legend: Slumberland. It is known as a realm made up of the entire collection of human dreams and desires. It is a vortex of chaos, fun and adventure where the remaining renegades and thought-provocateurs escape to in the middle of the night. Slumberland is a place of wonder where nothing is what it seems and the last remnants of human emotion remain pure and powerful. This is the last bastion where human dreams remain and a place where creativity and imagination are the source of life. 

Back in the “real” world in a small house by the outskirts of the only remaining city, the last unassimilated orphans reside. Two siblings thick as thieves and a few years apart: Sebastian and his older brother Mika, take turns assisting their mysteriously ill grandfather. The clock is ticking and danger looms near for neither sibling can stop themselves from dreaming. As the A.I. detects the illegal activity of the last dreamers, Mika inexplicably disappears, abandoning Sebastian and their grandfather. In the midst of the impending danger grandpa has tasked young and fearful Sebastian to venture into the Slumberland in order to obtain a magical potion before his time runs out. Sebastian must gather his poise and beware, for no one knows what he will encounter there. Perhaps terrible nightmares looking to eat his soul or perhaps an amazing adventure…perhaps he could find his long lost brother; that is if the A.I. does not get to him first.


This Teaser trailer just showcases a small part of this world. I created it to give the viewer a sense of the world. But there is a lot more information about the world you can find here:

For more info:
http://sebastiansodyssey.com/

SUBSCRIBE - to TheCGBros for more inspiring content!
http://www.youtube.com/user/thecgbro?sub_confirmation=1

title: A Sci-Fi Short Film: "0110" - by Taehoon Park | TheCGBros
description:
TheCGBros Presents "0110" by Taehoon Park - Humanity, who has always been pursuing perfection, has continued to develop machines. However, machines continue to develop on their own and build '0110', a more complete digital world that resembles the human world. However, machines that value only efficiency reduce unnecessary things one by one in the human world, and humanity eventually perish. And, eventually, the digital world gradually returns to its original form, that is, a form similar to a computer chip.

However,'H-6', the only survivor who gained eternal life by grafting his body and machinery. He try to escape from the tyranny of ruthless machines by using his cloned human'DH-6'. For more information, please see the details and links below:

TEAM:
Taehoon Park 
Score: Echoic

description:
Check out this awesome selection of character animation projects with VFX Breakdowns created by the talented team at iloura! For more information, please see the details and links below:

Official Website - http://www.iloura.com.au 

Don’t forget to like them on Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/ilouramelbourne) 

Follow them on Twitter(https://twitter.com/iloura_vfx) to keep up to date with Iloura news. 

Also add them on 
Linkedin -(https://www.linkedin.com/company/iloura) for the latest recruitment and job opportunity info.

About
--------------
Iloura is a VFX, animation and design studio motivated by creative problem solving and technical innovation.

Whilst Iloura"s highly regarded reputation has been built around its character animation work, the studio also produces outstanding results in matte painting, compositing, FX animation and motion design for the film, television and advertising industries.

The 100+ team is passionate about producing the best impact on screen - from the production of high quality, fast-turnaround pre-visualization through to a flawless final shot or sequence.

Clients respect Iloura"s skills and experience and consistently praise the team for their professionalism and flexibility. Always hungry for a challenge and a reason to push the boundaries on its creative skills, Iloura grows better and stronger with each experience.

TheCGBros Presents "FIGHT MACHINE" - A short film about the near-future where advanced military-grade prosthetic limbs are unleashed into society.

FIGHT MACHINE is a Short Film - created without a budget or film crew by Adam Hayes and Nick Hayes. The film is based on a graphic novel the brothers wrote in 2002.

Full Resolution Film Here: https://vimeo.com/251908615
Original Youtube film here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=f5uiYwdkQT4&t=10s

Visit our FIGHT MACHINE Virtual Reality Experience here: https://vimeo.com/251433153

Please subscribe to our Youtube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCJ1rl66acSHA-PFIUtL6MZA

Thank you for watching! Please like / comment / share / subscribe.

For more information please contact: adam@hayeshayes.com
Or visit: http://www.hayeshayes.com

Follow us on Instagram: @hayesbros

CREATED/DIRECTED/SHOT/EDITED BY: Adam Hayes / Nick Hayes.
ALL CGI BY: Adam Hayes / Nick Hayes. www.hayeshayes.com

title: CGI 3D Animated HD "Alleycats Trailer" by Blow Studio | CGMeetup
description:
CGI 3D Animated Alleycats Trailer by Blow Studio. Featured on http://www.cgmeetup.net/home/alleycats-trailer/

Nail, the last surviving warrior of the Siamese clan, stands at the top of a skyscraper. He’s about to break into enemy territory with only one thing on his mind: avenging his father’s death.

Alleycats is a short film produced by Blow Studio and directed by Alejandro Jimenez and Bernardo Gonzalez. A violent and dark action thriller set in a universe where gangs of cats fight to control the streets.

title: What is Needle Drop and How to Use it
description:
Sign up to Lickd with our link for 14 days free stock music and 50% off your first mainstream chart track  -- https://go.lickd.co/filmriotv2

When used well, needle drop can elevate a project beyond anything else. But what is needle drop, how should you use it, and what are some tips for editing that into your film or other content?

Today Ryan gives his tips and points out how some masters use this tool, including Quentin Tarantino, Edgar Wright, and Martin Scorsese.

title: Sci-Fi Series "Orbital Redux" | Episode 3: Ransomware  | DUST | Starring Yuri Lowenthal
description:
Watch the first two episodes of "Orbital Redux" here: https://www.youtube.com/watchv=mR5eo1norH8&list=PL2X2odndvaIcVPEGwwjf_pSyjMin6rnWG&index=1&t=99s 

Max and Tommie race against the clock as the virus takes over their ship and thrusts them into the crosshairs of Earth’s orbital defense systems. To Tommie’s dismay, Max makes the most of some very teachable moments.

"Orbital Redux" series by Steven Calcote

Starring Yuri Lowenthal (Spider-Man, Ben 10: Omniverse)

Connect with the Filmmakers: 
https://twitter.com/stevencalcote 
https://twitter.com/yurilowenthal 
https://www.instagram.com/yurilowenthal/ 

Series Description:
A former astronaut navigating life after NASA runs out of funding, is tasked with teaching a new pilot the ropes of the space program.

title: Sci-Fi Podcast "CHRYSALIS" | Part Ten: Revelation | DUST
description:
In the aftermath of the deadly battle, Daoket investigates the Terran’s claims that humanity was victim of genocide at the hands of the Xunvir Republic. What he discovers just may have the power to reshape the entire conflict.

"Revelation" is performed by Corey Hawkins and Lance Reddick.

"CHRYSALIS" is written by SH Serrano, adapted by Stephen Michael and Macklen Makhloghi, and executive produced by Corey Hawkins.

title: Horror Anthology: "Seven Moons" | Part 4 of "The Tree" | ALTER
description:
Subscribe to ALTER on YouTube: https://goo.gl/LnXRC3

A quest for fortune becomes a struggle for survival when a group of astronauts lands on a harsh alien planet seeking seeds from the Tree of Knowledge.

Anthology Description: Constructed from the wood of the Tree of Knowledge, The House moves through time and space, manifesting evil. Step inside its walls in this anthology series celebrating the horror storytelling tradition, from matinee chills to otherworldly terror.

"Seven Moons" (Part 4 of "The Tree") by Chris Bernier

#ALTER #horror #shortfilm

http://chrisbernier.com/

"Seven Moons" Credits:
Written and Directed by Chris Bernier

title: CGI 3D Animated Short: "Neocity Cyberpunk: " - by Student Project
description:
Check out this cool 3D animated VR project short called "Neocity Cyberpunk", a 5-person Virtual Reality Student Project with environments built in the Unreal Engine-4 during a semester at IED Milano (Italy). 

This was their first project using Unreal Engine-4 and was completed in about 4 months. For more information, please see the details and links below:

They used a mix between Cyberpunk 2077 and Shadowrun as references, and several films about Cyberpunk themes, like Blade Runner and Ghost in the Shell.

Feel free to comment with any advice or critics! (Remember that this it"s our first approach with Unreal4, we are simple students :P)
We hope you like it!

TEAM
. Dario Bonito https://www.artstation.com/artist/da3d (YT: https://goo.gl/3zs8AB )
. Matteo Bozzolan https://www.artstation.com/artist/matteobozzolan
. Nicolò Piccinini https://www.artstation.com/artist/npiccinini

#oldbanglamovie #banglamovie #bengalimovies #bengalifullmovie #bengalifilm #bengalimovie #banglafilm #banglacinema #banglamovies #bengalifullmovies #angelmovie

Movie : Kal Tumi Aleya
Language : Bengali
Genre : Classic, Drama
Producer : Debesh Ghosh
Director : Sachin Mukherji
Story : Ashutosh Mukherjee
Music Director : Uttam Kumar
Lyricist : Pulak Bandyopadhyay
Playback : Hemanta Mukherjee, Asha Bhosle
Release : 1977
Star Cast : Uttam Kumar, Supriya Devi, Sabitri Chatterjee, Kamal Mitra, Bhanu Bandopadhyay, Rabi Ghosh, Jahor Roy, Ajoy Ganguli, Sailen Mukherjee, Tarun Kumar, Dipti Roy, Sumita Sanyal, Nilima Das, Shekhar Chatterjee, Bankim Ghosh, Premangshu Bose

Synopsis:::
‘Kal Tumi Aleya’ is the story of rise of Dhirapada Chakroborty from his humble background to the post of general supervisor in Mr. Himanshu Mitra’s company. It’s his journey which shows his various relations with his neighbor whom he calls Sona boudi, Charu di who helps him get this job, Labanya Sarkar, the lady doctor of the company and Amit, Charu’s nephew. The film shows how he faces and handles different circumstances of life and business. It’s the story of Dhirpada’s journey in this delusionary world.

title: The Muck | Scary Short Horror film | Screamfest
description:
Subscribe and enjoy more horror on SCREAMFEST https://bit.ly/2MYvdFt
Laverne arrives home and decides to relax in the bathtub. She strips down, settles into the tub, and closes her eyes. Serenity at last... or so she thought! The Muck will leave you never wanting to take a bath again!

Directed By: 
Tony Wash
Produced By: 
Tony Wash, James Petersen, Robert Patrick Stern, Sarah Sharp, Kevin Lockhart
Written By: 
Tony Wash
Main Cast: 
Callie Stephens

The Muck premiered at Screamfest 2014.

********************************************************************
Screamfest Horror Film Festival is America’s largest and longest running horror film festival. The festival runs for 10 days in October in Los Angeles.  Screamfest, has launched careers - providing a platform for filmmakers and actors to showcase their latest work to enthusiasts and general audiences. We are proud to show you some of the short films that have screened at the festival over the years.

Every week we upload a fantastic short horror film that has premiered in our festival for you. Horror fans please LIKE, SHARE, FAVORITE or EMBED our videos with your friends and support our talented filmmakers.

title: CGI 3D Animated Trailers: "Manou the Swift" - by LUXX Studio
description:
Check out this awesome first official Teaser for "MANOU the SWIFT", an animated Feature from Germany to be released 2017 to entertain Families in Cinemas worldwide.

SYNOPSIS short:
————————————————————
MANOU the Swift grows up believing he is a seagull like his parents. He strives to swim, fish and fly like them but seems not very gifted. At summer race, he finds out why. To his great shock he was adopted as one of the much-hated Swifts. When Seagulls and swifts get into trouble MANOU fights like a hero – mixing the best of inventive swift and courageous seagull.

title: CGI 3D Animated Short  "Dubstep Dispute"  by - Fluxel Media
description:
Here is a great example of shear creativity as we join this lovable crew of droids as they solve their differences the only way dubstep robots know how. For more information please contact jason@fluxelmedia.com

The person behind Fluxelmedia is a 3d artist working full time as a real-time 3d artist, graphic designer and 3d interface designer. It is rare that his work can be displayed to the public so Fluxel Media was created as a platform to show off some fun side projects. 

A 3d animated short set to music by Nostalgia.

More info: fluxelmedia.com/fluxelmedia/projects/Dubstep_Dispute/Dubstep_Dispute.html

Nostalgia: facebook.com/dnbnostalgia

Full Length Track: soundcloud.com/nostalgia/knights-of-cydonia-nostalgia-dubstep-remix

Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/StargateStudios
Twitter - https://twitter.com/StargateStudios

EL PRÍNCIPE is set in the dangerous real- life neighbourhood of El Príncipe, in Ceuta, a Spanish town on the North African coast surrounded by Moroccan territory.  Because of the logistical challenges and safety considerations needed to shoot the entire series on location in Ceuta, the producers at Plano a Plano built sets in their Madrid soundstage and turned to the team at Stargate Studios Malta to transform these into the neighbourhood of El Príncipe through the use of Visual Effects.

The work carried out by the visual effects artists in Malta ranged from compositing shots filmed in full green environments to set extensions of Ceuta vistas using motion matte-paintings. There were also a considerable amount of full green driving scenes completed using the full library of landscapes and driving plates captured by the Stargate Orbis Rig during multiple visits to Ceuta.

The plot revolves around new police captain Morey arrives to Ceuta in order to manage the conflictive precinct of El Príncipe. Until then, the station was informally run by no-nonsense veteran cop Fran, who privileges his own rules to the Law in order to maintain peace in the cartel-ridden quarter. The first season, aired on Telecino in Spain, went on to achieve record breaking audience ratings, registering a 33.3% audience share (6.29 million viewers) in the Season Finale aired on May 6th 2014. The series has also aired in Chile and Italy.

El Príncipe won the Critics’ Choice Award for “its narrative quality and advanced production with the use of new technological resources” along with the Series of the Year Award (chosen by the writer’s guild) at the prestigious Festval 2014, Spain’s only TV-exclusive Festival.

About Stargate Malta
----------------
Stargate Studios is a global production company with an Emmy Award-winning visual effects department. The group, with studios around the world, has produced and serviced television series, feature films and commercials for 25 years.
The dynamic Stargate Studios Malta team is suited to develop and work with productions shooting both in Malta and off shore.

title: CGI & VFX Showreels: "Rigging Reel" - by Felix Cuevas
description:
Check out this latest Rigging Reel by the talented Felix Cuevas, showcasing his rigs/tools from various productions! For more information, please see the details and links below:

# fcRigger #
- A tool I developed after completing the animated features film Condorito, where I put everything I learned.
- Modular autoRig, that means is not only for standard structures like a biped, could be used for a complex character like a crab or a tree with dynamic on the branch.
- Has many rigging features that a rig need for production, like isolate rotation/translate parts, ikFk system, stretch and squash, dynamic parts for tails/antennas, etc.
- Each process of the rigging is kept in separate files because if there any change like pivots/skinning/blendShapes, the Rig can rebuild any time. ;)

A special thanks to Hernán Guerra, who was my Rigging Supervisor in the Film :)

Music: rarkid - MoonLapse

In the bustling, floating cloud city of Blus, every 13-year-old’s fate is decided by the revered Noggle ceremony - An official eye exam where you are bestowed with a specific pair of glasses that determine your future profession. title: CGI VFX Animated Spot : "98% Human" by - The Mill
description:
Check out this amazingly realistic CGI animated Chimpanzee featured in this spot by the incredibly talented team at The Mill! (The views expressed in this work are not necessarily those of TheCGBros or it"s creators - it is great CG though).

For more information or questions about this video, please visit the links below:

Website - http://www.themill.com/ LIKE THEM NOW!! :)
Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/MillChannel
Twitter - https://twitter.com/millchannel
Youtube - http://www.youtube.com/millchannel

Mill+ has teamed up with BBDO NY and PETA to create an astonishing and groundbreaking new spot "98% Human".

"98% Human" is part of PETA"s commitment to stop primates being used within the entertainment industries as actors. The Mill+ team, alongside BBDO NY, embarked on an incredibly ambitious journey to create a truly photo-real and completely life-like chimpanzee.

The spot focuses on the use of primates and is part of PETA"s campaign "The Great Ape Pledge" which drives viewers to the newly developed microsite greatapepledge.org where they can register to take the pledge and stop the use of primates as actors.

"98% Human" is a fully integrated campaign that is set to galvanize the creative industries into pledging to stop the use of primates as actors, companies already taking the pledge including BBDO NY and The Mill Group.

The Mill+ team was lead by animation director Angus Kneale and he explains some of the complexities and new techniques Mill+ created to bring the photo-real chimpanzee to life.

"This was one of the most exciting and challenging projects I"ve ever worked on. Crafting PETA "98% Human" was more than about creating a totally believable, photo-real CG Chimp. It was about establishing an emotional connection and empathy with the audience. In the past we would have used motion capture and mapped a human actor"s performance directly onto the CG character but we wanted to approach this project in a different way, so we decided to rely on the skill of our animators for the final chimp performances, only using an actor for previs.

"We pushed computer graphics imagery to a new level creating bespoke technology in muscle and skin simulation, higher than any other project or film to date. We achieved this by developing new techniques from simulated bloodstreams, skin tension and even individual pores at the base of every hair on the chimpanzee, all with the aim to create a creature that is practically indistinguishable from his flesh and blood counterpart".

"98% Human" is a collaboration between the BBDO NY creative team lead by Toygar Bazarkaya and Mill+ NY and the spot demonstrates the partnership between creativity and technology by delivering on PETA"s powerful message that you do not need to use live primates as actors, now that we can create fully life-like, photo-real primates.


**The views and opinions expressed in the videos on this YouTube Channel, do not necessarily reflect those of TheCGBros or its affiliates and associated companies.**

Movie : Boudi
Language : Bengali
Genre : Drama, Family
Producer : Bhuban Mohan Saha, Anil Dutta
Director : Dilip Bose
Music Director : Robin Chatterjee
Lyricist : Pranab Roy
Release : 1968
Star Cast : Sandhya Rani, Lily Chakravarty, Sukhen Das, Anup Kumar, Jahor Roy, Anil Chatterjee, Kali Banerjee, Bikash Roy, Pahari Sanyal, Kamal Mitra, Tarun Kumar, Prasad Mukherjee, Kalipada Chakraborty, Molina Devi, Padmadevi, Rajlakshmi Devi, Ashok Mukherjee, Mani Srimani, Banani Choudhury, Master Shankar, Master Bapi

Synopsis:::
‘Boudi’ is the story of Ajay’s sister-in-law and her sacrifices for his better future. Ajay’s brother Hari is poor. But, he leaves no stone unturned to get his brother educated. His sister-in-law pawns all her ornaments so that he can continue his education. Hari is forced to steal when he is unable to save Aju’s exam fee. Aju’s sister-in-law tells Aju that Hari stole to buy ornaments for her so that he doesn’t feel guilty. Aju gets angry and leaves home. Hari is jailed. Hari’s younger son Ratan dies due to lack of treatment. They shift to the city when Hari is released from jail. Hari starts working in a factory where Aju is the manager. In the mean time Aju realizes his mistake. Circumstances finally unite the brothers and also unite Aju with his sister-in-law.

title: CGI Animated Short Film HD "PolyWorld - Dusty Land Emperor Episode II" by Joan Borguñó | CGMeetup
description:
CGI Animated PolyWorld Dusty Land Emperor Short Films by Joan Borguñó. Featured on http://www.cgmeetup.net/home/polyworld-short-films/

PolyWorld – The Wild in the Forest (Episode I) https://youtu.be/VPEF_97EL3w
PolyWorld – Dusty Land Emperor (Episode II) https://youtu.be/eQiTp7X3dJo
PolyWorld – The King in the North (Episode III) https://youtu.be/s39tS9ZcvCU

PolyWorld – Dusty Land Emperor (Episode II) 
PolyWorld is a personal 3D animation project that tells the story of a low-poly-style world inhabited by different kind of living beings. There are three episodes in total.

This second episode (Dusty Land Emperor) showcases the dangers that lurk under the calm and silent lands of the desert.
"The powerful are not as powerful as they seem, nor the weak as weak."

Music composed by a very talented friend of the author: Jose García Baños.

title: Sci-Fi Podcast "CHRYSALIS" | Part Five: Fallout | DUST
description:
Daoket and Nakstani arrive on the Xunvirian planet Yovit, the supposed next target of the mysterious enemy. But sooner than they could have ever expected, a terror arrives from above; a mechanical weapon the likes of which the galaxy has never seen. As the attack on Yovit begins, Daoket and Nakstani witness firsthand the Terran’s true capabilities.

"Fallout" is performed by Corey Hawkins, Toni Collette, and Jen Christopher.

"CHRYSALIS" is written by SH Serrano, adapted by Stephen Michael and Macklen Makhloghi, and executive produced by Corey Hawkins.

Visuals provided by DUST FLOW. FLOW is a meditative experience designed to send you into a state of digital relaxation. 

Subscribe to the DUST Newsletter: http://eepurl.com/gnTIbD

#DUST #scifi #shortfilm 

About DUST:
DUST presents thought-provoking science fiction content, exploring the future of humanity through the lens of science and technology. From timeless classics to cutting-edge movies, series, short films, and podcasts, DUST acquires, produces and distributes all content types.

DUST is also available on Amazon FireTV, AndroidTV, AppleTV, Fubo, IMDBTV, iOS, Peacock, Roku, Redbox, Samsung TV, Sling, STIRR, Tivo, Vizio, Xumo and 7Plus. On our OTT platforms, we offer cutting-edge and classic feature films, series, podcasts, and our entire shorts library. #TheFutureAwaits

title: Horror Short Film "We Got a Monkey's Paw" | ALTER | Flashback Friday
description:
Subscribe to ALTER on YouTube: https://goo.gl/LnXRC3

Roommates Zack and Jakki get into an impawsibly hairy situation while monkeying around with the occult. 

"We Got a Monkey's Paw" by Aaron Pagniano

More About "We Got a Monkey's Paw":
Zack and Jakki are you typical “odd couple” roommates. Jakki likes staying in, reading a good book now and again; while Zack has other hobbies like waking the dead. Things get hairy when Zack convinces Jakki to spend the day making wishes on a Monkey’s Paw. Soon the two find themselves doing backflips trying to undo the cataclysmic series of events they’ve set off. Ghost brides, demon boxes, dead-y bears, oh my! This paw is definitely in the wrong hands.

Directed by Aaron Pagniano
Written by Zack Ogle & Aaron Pagniano
Produced by Travis Campbell, Zack Ogle, & Aaron Pagniano
Music by Tom Hatfield
Cinematography by Carissa Dorson (additional photography by Idan Menin)
Edited by Zack Ogle
VFX by Aaron Pagniano
Gaffer- Maryn McGaw
Sound Recordists- Spencer Showalter and Clinton Cornwall
Hair and Makeup- Kathleen Pardo
Production Assistant- Stephanie Carnes
Colorist- Pedro Vivas Hernandez

Starring- Jakki Jandrell & Zack Ogle

#ALTER #horror #shortfilm

About ALTER:
ALTER is an ever-expanding platform for the most daring storytellers in the world of horror. We are a home, community and launching pad for our filmmakers. Slip into the dark, disturbing corners of cutting-edge horror.
 
Filmmakers should visit https://filmfreeway.com/alterdustsubmissions to submit your horror shorts. (Only completed horror shorts will be considered. Unsolicited scripts or pitches will be immediately deleted without review.)

title: 3D Animated Fan Trailer 4K: "ST: New Horizons - Assimilation" - by Steam Workshop
description:
Check out this amazing Star Trek Fan-Art-Mod-Trailer called "ST: New Horizons - Assimilation" in 4K created as a a non-commercial mod-project/total conversion of the award winning grand strategy game Stellaris by Paradox Interactive created by the talented team at Steam Workshop! For more information, please see the details and links below:

Offical Beta Release Trailer of ST: New Horizons - Assimilation.

Check out this link for more: 
 https://www.blendernation.com/2017/08/31/st-new-horizons-4k-game-trailer/

Production Details:
ST New Horizons (Steam Workshop Shortlink: https://goo.gl/yijoih) is a Non-Commercial mod-project/total conversion of the award winning grand strategy game Stellaris by Paradox Interactive.

Credits:
Concept and Idea: Alexander Weide, Marc Schmelzer, Musa von Homeyer
Production,Directing, Compositing, Edit and VFX: Alexander Weide
Animation: Marc Schmelzer

Music: Sam Dillard
Sound FX and Sound Mastering: Mat R. Allen 
Thies - Gordon Wäß
Roland Jeske

Special Thanks to: Chris Kuhn, Raul Mamoru, NASA for Reference Space Images, and to the Entire Team of Paradoxical Development Group

Used Tools: 
Houdini, Blender, Natron, Fusion Lite, Davinci Resolve Lite, Renderengines: Cycles and Mantra on Linux

Production Time: ~2200 hours including ship modeling and preproduction phase

DISCLAIMER:

Star Trek and all related marks, logos and characters are solely owned by CBS Studios Inc. This fan production is not endorsed by, sponsored by, nor affiliated with CBS, Paramount Pictures, or any other Star Trek franchise, and is a non-commercial fan-made film intended for recreational use. No commercial exhibition or distribution is permitted. No alleged independent rights will be asserted against CBS or Paramount Pictures.

description:
Subscribe to ALTER on YouTube: https://goo.gl/LnXRC3

Severe allergies drive a man to the brink of insanity as he desperately attempts to rid his body of mucus. 

"Death Snot" by Charlie Schwan

#ALTER #horror #shortfilm

Connect with the Filmmakers: 
https://www.instagram.com/crschwan/
https://www.instagram.com/jacklangloiscamera/
https://www.instagram.com/noedelagarza_/

"Death Snot" Credits:
Written/Directed/Edited by Charlie Schwan
Produced by Jack Langlois
Starring: Noé De La Garza 
Director of Photography: Jack Langlois
Gaffer: Dustin Bloodgood
1st Assistant Camera: Kyle Summers
Key Grip: Laurence Geronilla 
Colorist: Billy Landry
Original Score by: Charles Moret
Post Sound Mixing: Jonny Shore
Sound Recordist/Mixer: Paddy Baigrie 
Production Designer: Emmie Ray
VFX by: Charlie Schwan and Dustin Maxwell 
Creature Sculpting by: Emmie Campbell
Vacuum Salesman: Phillip-Charlie Daniell
Girlfriend Phone Call/Vacuum lover: Emmie Ray
News Anchor: MJ Wolfe 
Vacuum Lover: Jacob Bottorff 
Infected Man: Montrell Harrell 
Infected Couple: Jen McQueeney and Max Friedman 
Production Assistant: Cobb Bottorff 

About ALTER:
ALTER is an ever-expanding platform for the most daring storytellers in the world of horror. We are a home, community and launching pad for our filmmakers. Slip into the dark, disturbing corners of cutting-edge horror.
 
Filmmakers should visit https://filmfreeway.com/alterdustsubmissions to submit your horror shorts. (Only completed horror shorts will be considered. Unsolicited scripts or pitches will be immediately deleted without review.)
 
Watch more: https://goo.gl/yvB7EM 
Website: watchalter.com
Follow us on Facebook: https://goo.gl/X4LhGr
Follow us on Instagram: https://goo.gl/G6W7zn 
Sign-up for the ALTER and DUST Newsletter: http://eepurl.com/dChYXb

About Gunpowder + Sky:
Creating content that resonates and impacts pop culture conversation, by empowering creators to take risks and experiment relentlessly in the pursuit of novel stories and formats.

title: CGI 3D Animated Short: "The Girl & the Cloud"  - by Studio AKA/Red Knuckles Production
description:
Enjoy this heartwarming Christmas story of one little girl"s "Perfect Surprise" when her Dad brought her back her very own snow cloud. This year"s campaign continues that story and imagines what came next - in an animated storybook form. In 2014, Dublin agency BOYS & GIRLS helped Three Ireland tell this story... 

This charming 2min 50" film illustrates the ensuing friendship between Anna and her cloud ever since that memorable Christmas morning. For a while, everything is all fun & games, but as time passes and seasons change, Anna realizes that her cloud is unhappy as the weather gets warmer. As Christmas approaches, Anna"s only wish is to return her friend home ...

This heartfelt spot was adapted & directed by STUDIO AKA"s PHILIP HUNT from an original story by the team at Boys & Girls, and produced in record time working with a specialist crew assembled at RED KNUCKLES under lead artists MARIO UCCI & RICK THIELE. A dedicated group of animators brought the characters to life within a look which drew directly from original artwork by designers OLGA STERN & AMANDINE PECHARMAN.

Using a projection texturing method to create a unique look somewhere between 2D & 3D, the production team worked round the clock to blend the 2D artwork with 3D Cgi characters, and the final touches were provided by composer Denis Kilty and the wonderful tones of narrator Ciaran Hinds.

The film will air on RTE and social media in the run-up to Christmas and will be available to view, in full, online. A 60" & 40" cut down will also run on TV throughout November and December.

Client: Three Ireland
Agency: Boys and Girls
Original Storyline: Boys and Girls
Adapted & Directed by: Philip Hunt 
Producer: Sharon Titmarsh
Produced by: Studio AKA & Red Knuckles
Narration: Ciaran Hinds
Original Music: Denis Kilty
Art Direction: 
Amandine Pecharman & Olga Stern
Lead CG artists: Mario Ucci & Rick Thiele
Lead Animator: Conor Ryan
Animators: Pascale Bories, Ning-En Chang, Fabiana Ciatti, Juliette Coutellier, Ines Pagniez, Tammy Smith, Paul Torris.
Lighting/Compositing: Mario Ucci. Rick Thiele, Clementine Delcourt, Clarisse Valeix. Modelling/Texturing: Francis-Xavier Martins, Rigging: Laura Trout Editing: Matt Dollings
Artists: Amandine Pecharman, Olga Stern,Tristan Menard, Antoine Birot, Manddy Wickets, Steve Small
Sound Design: Locky Butler
Violin Darragh McGrath, Cello Matt Rafter
All proceeds from the accompanying book by Boys and Girls go to BARNADOS.

title: CGI VFX Tutorials Promo :"Cinema 4D Advanced Production Techniques"
description:
***THIS IS FOR ALL OUR SUBSCRIBERS*** who have asked us where they can get the best advanced C4D training, Take your Cinema4D skills to the next level with Cinema4d advanced production techniques!! Watch some of the top C4D artist from around the world show how they do their stuff!!

Take your Cinema4d skills to the next level with Cinema4d advanced production techniques from Simon Holmedal, Paul Everett, Raphael Rau, Simon Fiedler, Derya and Douwe in a 13 episode series recorded live in Copenhagen at a 2 day seminar hosted by Pingo van der Brinkloev. Over 8 hours of screen captured material has been edited into an intensive package with in depth talks about Mograph, Xpresso, workflow, modeling, photo realistic rendering with Vray®, NPR rendering, Python, particles, plugins and dirty tricks. Though the techniques are advanced, you will be able to tag along and replicate the various workflows. Scene files are included!

Available via Vimeo on demand
https://vimeo.com/ondemand/c4dapt

title: A CGI 3D Short Film: "Le Secret De Mona Lisa - The Secret Of Mona Lisa" - by ESMA | TheCGBros
description:
TheCGBros Presents "Le Secret De Mona Lisa - The Secret Of Mona Lisa" by  ESMA - Valeska and Salma take out the children from their district to Le Louvre. They're beeing refused the access because they don't have the "right outfits". So they decide to steal Mona Lisa. After stolen Mona Lisa, Valeska and Salma try to escape without being caught by the Guard, busy doing his nails.
Valeska et Salma, font une sortie au Louvre avec les enfants de la MJC de leur quartier. L'entrée dans le musée leur est refusée pour motif d'un "style vestimentaire inapproprié". Elles décident alors de voler Mona Lisa. Après avoir dérobé le célèbre tableau, les voleuses tentent de s'évader sans attirer l'attention du gardien occupé à se faire les ongles.For more information, please see the details and links below:

TEAM:
Réalisateurs / directors: Dylan ANTONIO MOTA, Anaïs BLANCQUART, Lisa BELAIR, Orlane COLIN, Ferdinand FRANÇOIS, Inès HAZM, Andréa LAFFONT, Grégoire LAHOUSSE
Voix / voices: Laura BLANC, Michel ELIAS, Nathalie HOMS, Camille LAMACHE, Sarah SCHUMACHER
Musique / music: Marc Da COSTA
Son / sound: Sébastien FOURNIER, Kevin GIRAUD, Alexis LAUGIER, Baptiste LEBLANC, Yoann PONCET, José VINCENTE - STUDIO DES AVIATEURS

Film d'animation réalisé dans le cadre de la formation cinéma d'animation 3D de l'école ESMA (promo 2021).

title: A Sci-Fi Short Film: "IMMERSION" - by Raphael Rogers
description:
Immersion has taken the world by storm. Initially created as a virtual gaming platform more enticing than reality, its simulations have become so convincing that criminals are now being treated as patients inside virtual reality. Pairing the worlds of Immersion with nanotechnology has unlocked the key to modifying brain behavior. We can now cure a murderer, heal an addict. But change can happen both ways.

Contact: immersionscifi@gmail.com

Tech stuff:
Shot with Red Epic and Sony a7s primarily. One 5DIII shot. 
Anamorphic lenses and Canon Lenses.
Edited with Premiere. All the VFX was done by two of us using After Effects.

Managed by Scott Glassgold of I AM Entertainment
APA - Ryan Saul, Adam Perry

title: **Award Winning** CGI VFX Short  Film:  "CIRCLE"  - by Alexander Heringer
description:
Enjoy this Award Winning short film which depicts a young woman in despair, who after experiencing a tragic loss escapes into the seemingly perfect past. She loses herself in vivid memories and starts to neglect her real life. A constant inner struggle emerges between past and present, distorting her perception of reality.

Directed by Alexander Heringer

Ahmad Saleh, a Student Academy Award winning screenwriter, wrote “Circle” to cope with

the losses he endured during the conflict in the Middle East.

Starring Mira Maria Wissmann, Moritz Pliquet

Produced by Daniel Piechocki

Cinematography by Pius Neumaier

title: CGI VFX Breakdowns "Game of Thrones: Season 2" by Pixomondo | TheCGBros
description:
Check out this VFX Breakdown Reel from Pixomondo, showcasing their work on "Game of Thrones: Season 2." The international company, led by Rainer Gombos and Juri Stanossek, created fire-breathing dragons and extended sets of Westeros. Filming took place in Belfast, Croatia, and Iceland, with Pixomondo studios across Europe, the US, and China contributing. Dan Katcher designed the dragons, while the Frankfurt team animated them. They also augmented battle scenes, set extensions, and creatures. Nine out of twelve facilities worked on the project, with turnaround times varying from six weeks to four months. Additional vendors included Baked FX and Entity FX.

#Shortfilms
#CGI
#3D
#VFX
#VFXBreakdowns
#Reels
#MotionGraphics


Nine of Pixomondo"s twelve facilities contributed to the project. Stuttgart served as the lead and did most of the set extension work and matte paintings as well as creature work and some CG gore. Frankfurt created the dragons and Berlin worked on shots featuring fluid simulations. London and Burbank handled compositing and 3D work though Beijing composited the shots with the direwolves and was also responsible for some of the long establishing shots as well as crowd replication and matte paintings. Munich, Hamburg and Shanghai assisted with compositing, with Shanghai also contributing to 3D shots. 

Episode turnaround time has varied greatly depending on the complexity of the work. Unlike many shows, principal photography was mostly complete when the plates were turned over to Pixomondo in December 2011. Delivery of episodes has ranged anywhere from six weeks to four months and episodes feature anywhere from 60 to over 140 VFX shots.

In addition to Pixomondo, Gombos enlisted two outside vendors, Baked FX and Entity FX, to work on about 250 shots. The companies handled mostly paint fixes and cleanup, as well as some rain and snow augmentation.

Movie : Pratisodh
Language : Bengali
Genre : Drama, Action
Producer : Ratna Chatterjee
Director : Sukhen Das
Story : Bari Devi
Music Director : Ajoy Das
Lyricist : Pulak Bandyopadhyay, Samir Ghosh
Playback : Hemanta Mukherjee, Manna Dey, Tarun Banerjee, Arundhati Holme Chowdhury, Shyamashree Majumdar, Kishore Kumar
Release : 1981
Star Cast : Prosenjit Chatterjee, Uttam Kumar, Mahua Roy Choudhury, Sukhen Das, Soumitra Chatterjee, Sabitri Chatterjee, Bhanu Bandopadhyay, Anup Kumar, Rabi Ghosh, Shubhendu Chattopadhyay, Gyanesh Mukherjee, Shakuntala Barua, Mrinal Mukherjee, Shambhu Bhattacharya, Anamika Saha, Master Partho

Synopsis:::
Pratisodh' is the story of revenge. Surja Sekhar Choudhury and his son Sashanka are rich and proud landlords who don't care for the problems of the poor villagers. Raja stands up for the villagers and fights for them. Raja insults Sashanka's sister Sumita. In order to take revenge against him Sashanka deceitfully defeats Raja in a stick game and married his love Gauri. Raja challenges Surja that he must get married his daughter Sumita married to him if he wins the panchayat election. After winning the election Raja forcefully marries Sumita. Though Sumita doesn't accept this relationship initially and hates Raja and his family, she gradually falls in love with her. A tiff ensues between Sashanka and Raja when Sashanka dishonors Raja's elder sister Durga. As Raja is about to kill Sashanka Gauri comes and begs for his life. Raja spares Sashanka and he realizes his mistake. He accepts Gauri and both the families are happily united.

description:

title: Mondays: Is Film School Necessary, Beards & What If Josh Left Film Riot?
description:

title: The DUST Files "Rebels" | DUST
description:
Experience a few cautionary stories about people on the edge of societies in the DUST compilation, "Rebels". 

"Rebels" Features: 
"Zero" by The Brothers Lynch (Keith & David)
Starring Bella Ramsey (The Last of Us, Game of Thrones)
After a mysterious electro-magnetic pulse renders the world's technology useless, a young girl ﬁnds herself isolated and alone with only her father's strict set of rules to keep her alive.

"Stray" by Nora Unkel 
A virus eliminates all males. When a woman discovers something impossible, she risks the whole world's destruction to protect it.

"Capsules" by Burton Chaikin
In a not so distant future, humans must take pharmaceuticals to feel any emotion at all. This is the story about two people who have been prescribed to take the next step in their relationship. 

"EXILE" by Mark Freiburger
A Sheriff is awakened by his daughter, alerting him of a prowler on their ranch. As father and daughter head out into the woods to track something that isn't human.

title: BABY MINE | Omeleto
description:
A woman recruits an ex-soldier to rescue her child.


BABY MINE is used with permission from Nour Wazzi. Learn more at https://panaceaproductions.com.


Sarah's estranged and volatile husband Soroush has kidnapped their fragile, sickly daughter Etti, sending the mother into a tailspin of fear and anxiety.

She recruits a neighbor, Mike, who has witnessed the kidnapping to help her with her dilemma. But her neighbor harbors a subtle yet unmistakable prejudice against Middle Eastern people, as well as a few secrets of his own. As a new threat emerges and layers of deception peel away, Etti's life hangs in the balance between two warring parents.

Inspired by true events, director Nour Wazzi's stylish and atmospheric thriller harnesses the gripping narrative power of the thriller genre to probe thought-provoking questions about identity and expectations. With a foundation of impeccable craftsmanship and excellently structured writing and editing, viewers race through a high-stakes situation, upending expectations and questioning assumptions in the process.

The storytelling accomplishes a lot in the short film format, packing an immense amount of tension and suspense as well as deftly constructed and highly complex characters. But its strategies are also quite sophisticated: it takes Sarah as its engine, and we experience much of the film's events through her eyes.

But in doing so, we see Soroush as an antagonist, vilifying him alongside Sarah as a monstrous, unpredictable force. Yet is Sarah who she seems? As we confront the reliability of her character, our perception of what's real and what isn't crumbles, and we're forced to question our own assumptions.

This tricky high-wire act of perception and reality is elevated by an excellent cast, the most prominent of which is actor Alexander Siddig, beloved to STAR TREK audiences and renowned for performances in films like SYRIANA and KINGDOM OF HEAVEN. Actor Rachael Stirling gives a controlled, precise yet emotional performance as a mother with an unmistakable deep love for her daughter and a need to be needed. It's the trickiest role in the story, but Stirling stays true to the core of her character's feelings for her daughter, making her understandable even though the story's twists and turns.

The thriller genre is known for its high stakes, the construction of high-stakes pressure-cooker situations and often an upending of characters or information, which often causes audiences to reconsider their own perception of earlier narrative events and ideas. Like a Mobius strip turning inside out, the pleasure is in learning to see a story in one way, only to have it change shape with a carefully calibrated twist.

BABY MINE fulfills all the thriller tropes, and while it's entertaining as the genre promises, it also accomplishes the work of upending our implicit ideas about race, gender and parenthood. We see how easy it is in volatile, visceral situations to default to pernicious assumptions and play upon them in order to "win" or dominate. The film's resonance, therefore, is not just as a finely conceived and sleekly wrought piece of entertainment -- though it is -- but in the work it asks of the audience, to look at themselves and their beliefs and perhaps questions how easily they are manipulated, both in the story and perhaps in real life.

title: CGI 3D Animated Shorts : "A Fistful of Presents" by - Cole Clark + Ringling | TheCGBros
description:
Check out this awesome CGI animated short film by the talented Cole Clark, and produced at the prestigious Ringling College of Art and Design. For more information, please see the details and links below:

Contact info:
http://www.coleclark.com
colevfx@gmail.com
Voice Talent: Peter Leake and Adam Ratner
Music by Corey Wallace | coreywallace.com/
Sound Design by Mutante Media | mutantemedia.com/

Film info:
----------------
I recently wrapped on A Fistful of Presents in early April. Preproduction began in December of 2013, and full 3D production began in August of 2014. The models were completed in August, the rigging and layout were completed in September. The animation and cloth simulations were completed early December, and then I spent the rest of the month learning some of the more advanced features in Nuke and setting up the hair simulations. I then lit and composited furiously until the April deadline.

I animated, rigged, and assembled the scenes in Maya 2015. The characters and most of the props were modeled in ZBrush. The Santa character also had wrinkle maps that were heavily dependent on doing math with the layers function and displacement maps generated from ZBrush. Almost every asset was also textured with Mari and Crazybump.

Rendering A Fistful of Presents has been really interesting. Initially, when I initially modeled and textured the characters in August all the shaders were built for RMS18 shaders. When RMS19 was released, I had to switch in December to a beta build version because I benefitted heavily from the vast upgrade to the Render Man hair shader. I then had to switch some of the shaders again in January when we updated to the full release. I honestly don"t believe it would have been possible to match the quality of what I made with the time restrictions I had before RMS19.

SUBSCRIBE - to TheCGBros for more inspiring content!
http://www.youtube.com/user/thecgbro?sub_confirmation=1

title: CGI Animated Short Film "Feeling Sad” by Eddy.tv | CGMeetup
description:
CGI 3D Animated Short Film: Imaginary Friend Society Feeling Sad by Eddy.tv. Featured on 
http://www.cgmeetup.net/home/imaginary-friend-society-feeling-sad-uri-lotan/

Hornet and Uri Lotan were tapped by RPA to participate in their film series for the Pediatric Brain Tumor Foundation. Cancer is scary and overwhelming in itself, but to be diagnosed as a child can be even more terrifying, as well as incredibly confusing. By creating a group of characters called the Imaginary Friend Society, RPA embraced the task and conceived these films to help teach kids about the process of cancer treatment in a compassionate and yet realistic manner.

There is an emotional clarity to Uri’s work and a true intentional craft to his characters' actions. The piece chosen for Uri was Feeling Sad. And what is sadness? It is such a broad topic, yet RPA and Uri did a fantastic job writing the script and developing the direction. We were drawn to this film as it had a depth and an intelligence to its approach to sadness. These are kids that we are speaking to, and yet we do not want to speak down to them, thus the tone of the film had to feel real and honest.

For Hornet, this work was deeply personal. As with most people nowadays, many of our team have been touched by cancer, so there was not a hesitation to dive right in and be a part of it. And being a pro bono film, it was a true investment of our time, Uri's time and the entire studio's time. It was an honorable task to create a film that can help these children navigate the immensity of emotions, and still present it in a tone that is approachable and graspable.

Eddy.tv https://www.eddy.tv/

title: CGI 3D Animated Short "Sonova" - by Justin Boon
description:
Synopsis
On the brink of extinction, humanity flips the switch on artificial intelligence, the Hail Mary of a collective species. AI solves every problem conceivable, even mortality. But what happens when humanity attains digital immortality? What happens next? Follow Sonova on her journey into discovering what makes us, human.
Background

“It is no longer a question of whether AI turns out good or bad, the question is, will AI love humanity?” Sonova was an idea conceived by Justin, inspired by the numerous articles online about the implications of humanity as a species, developing true artificial intelligence (most of the credit goes to waitbutwhy.com). In addition to that, we wanted to give a different take on AI as the world was already saturated with numerous movies about AI gone rogue. With that in mind, Justin, Arturo and Mairin conceived of a story which would also incorporate subtle commentary on how humanity as a species already is a slave to technology. We wanted to delve into how we perceive our environment as humans, and created Sonova, a human, having attained immortality by shedding her humanity, seeks to rediscover what makes humans, human. We wanted it to be very intimate, where you watch Sonova discover her senses one by one, almost childlike. Namely, sight, hearing and touch, as we are unable to portray smell or taste with today’s current technology. Through her HUD display, you can watch her talk to T.A.I, and their interactions over the course of her reincarnations. Some viewers have asked us if T.A.I is the antagonist, the “bad” character in the film, the answer we have is that it’s up to your own interpretation, just like how there are people for and against AI in the real world. 

Music
Music and original soundtrack all done by Daniel Hoshor, voiceover by Chloe Kay. Both are part of our team.

title: A Sci-Fi Short Film: "THE SIGNAL" - by Marcus Stokes
description:
Enjoy this VFX Sci-Fi Short Film... 2046.  A new energy source, created to solve the world"s energy crisis, is believed to have deadly side effects.  When The Signal"s inventor chooses to help a girl warn the public, he gains an unlikely ally to save the world from his own creation.  Starring Michael Ealy and Grace Phipps, Written and Directed by Marcus Stokes!

On the web - http://www.thesignalmovie.com

This live action short film was shot in downtown Los Angeles over a weekend.  The post production and visual effects took considerably longer and were done by the writer/director Marcus Stokes and a few additional VFX artists.  

Starring:
Michael Ealy, Grace Phipps, Doc Duhame, Casey Adams, Zack Duhame, Brian Buccellato, Ciera Payton, and Gonzalo Escudero

title: CGI Animated Breakdowns : "Epic Animation Tips" - by Patrick Giusiano
description:
Check out these very revealing shot breakdowns from the CGI Animated Film "Epic" by the talented animator, Patrick Giusiano! Check below for more details:

Hi, I"m Patrick Giusiano, I"m a French animator, currently working in Blue Sky Studios and I had the great privilege to work on Epic. Working with Chris Wedge and all the Amazing Blue Sky animation team was one of the most enjoyable moments in my career. By working on my shots, showing them in dailies, I learned things to help facilitate the life of a shot from the Kick off to the Final delivery. I thought it would be interesting to share what I learned in this video... Here is an educational video showing different personal animation techniques I developed during EPIC. I hope it will bring animation students fresh ideas on how to handle their shots. I"m sure you"ll also have fun watching it even if you don"t know anything about animation :-) I tried my best to explain the main steps I followed by displaying them in a fun and enjoyable video...

***THIS VIDEO IS FOR EDUCATION PURPOSES ONLY***

Epic is a property of Fox and Blue Sky Studios

© 2014 Blue Sky Studios, Inc. All rights reserved

http://blueskystudios.com/films/epic/
http://www.epicthemovie.com/

EPIC tells the story of an ongoing battle between the forces of good, who keep the natural world alive, and the forces of evil, who wish to destroy it. When a teenage girl finds herself magically transported into this secret universe, she teams up with an elite band of warriors and a crew of comical, larger-than-life figures, to save their world... and ours.

title: CGI Procedural Animated Short : "De Planeta" by Leonardo Cavaletti
description:
Watch this fantatsic CGI Procedural Animated Short created by the talented Leonardo Cavaletti!! "De Planeta (latin for "about a planet") is a short and stylised procedural animation that revolves around birth, life and death of a little planet, showing all the colorful wonders it has to offer by following it through the ages with a fast-paced and engaging rhythm, culminating into the triumph of modernity over nature, with all the consequences that may follow upon it". For a shorter and more friendly description, though, I would call it "sexy, procedural low-poly planets".

The project was created entirely using sideFX Houdini, turning away from the fact that the tool is mainly used for realist VFX work and proving that its procedural capabilities can be used to deliver a colorful and playful animation with a distinct look. The short was featured in the Houdini Student Showreel 2013 at Siggraph.

http://about.me/leonardo.cavaletti

Music Track - "Guillaume Tell (William Tell) - Guillaume Tell: Overture"

title: CGI Animated Short : "MORIENDO" by Andrey Pratama
description:
Stylized CGI animated short by Andrey Pratama. Please visit http://www.facebook.com/themoriendo for more information.

Moriendo is an animated short created by Andrey Pratama and took 4 months to complete. The story itself is inspired by a story titled "Sebuah Pagi dan Seorang Lelaki Mati" (A Morning Star and A Dead Man) by Noviana Kusumawardhani - A Balinese writer.
The film centers around a lady who awaits death while she lingers on her unknown dearest to come home. One morning the lady meets a gaffer, who promises her that he would reap her soul once she allows him to. Thus she begins to make peace with her sorrowful memories that time can not erase.

All ths stuff created by Andrey Pratama
My Portfolio behance.net/andreypratama
Music by Patrick Rundbladh

title: CGI & VFX Breakdowns: "THE WOLF OF WALL STREET" - by Scanline VFX | TheCGBros
description:
Check out this revealing VFX Breakdown "THE WOLF OF WALL STREET"  from the talented team at Scanline VFX.  Scanline VFX played a key role in "The Wolf of Wall Street" by working on the storm at sea and helicopter flight sequences. They used their proprietary fluid simulation software, Flowline, to create realistic stormy ocean effects, integrating these with live-action footage to achieve seamless transitions. Additionally, they worked on the helicopter scenes, focusing on detailed modeling, texturing, and compositing to ensure realistic and immersive visuals. These contributions significantly enhanced the film's visual impact and storytelling​.

title: CGI 3D Animated Short "Welcome to Paradise"  - by Welcome to Paradise Team
description:
Enjoy this CGI 3D Animated short film...Follow our main character, Eggs, whilst he drags what seems to be a massive entertainment machine across a vast wasteland. What lengths will he go through to keep this machine running?

Welcome to Paradise by Alex Baró, Amélie Talarmain, Veronika Epsteina and Simeon
Ganev

(if the names are too long write just the surnames: By Baró, Talarmain, Epsteina and Ganev)

The website for the film with all credits is here: http://www.wtpfilm.co.uk/

Alex Baró Cayetano: www.alexbaro.com
Amélie Talarmain: www.amelietalarmain.com
Veronika Epsteina: www.vepsteina.co.uk
Simeon Ganev: www.simeonganev.co.uk

The film was made by mainly four people. Veronika Epsteina, Amélie Talarmain, Simeon Ganev and myself, Alex Baró Cayetano. But aside from us we got help from some other talented people,
all named in our website. We all studied the same degree at the University of Hertfordshire and joined together to make Welcome to Paradise our final year film. We all come from different countries (Sweden, France, Britain and Spain) and had different ideas to bring together.

title: Sci-Fi Short Film: "Déjeuner sur l'herbe" | DUST
description:
A brilliant scientist sees his convictions crumble during a picnic at the lake.

"Déjeuner sur l'herbe" by Jules Bourges, Jocelyn Charles, Nathan Harbonn viaud, and Pierre Rougemont

Connect with the Filmmakers:

More About "Déjeuner sur l'herbe":
Exploring themes of science, religion and alien life, the short film centres around a “brilliant” scientist who finds his whole perspective on life falling apart after an unexpected encounter during a picnic by a lake. Having built his career and fame around skepticism, his life loses all meaning and he’s left a broken man by this experience that challenges all he’s stood for.

title: CRUSH | Omeleto
description:
A young woman eyes a man on the subway.


CRUSH is used with permission from Giacomo Gex. Learn more at https://giacomogex.com.


Natalie is taking the subway one day in New York when she spots an intriguing man reading a book amid a sea of others absorbed in their phones. When he gets off, she makes a spontaneous decision to follow and talk with him.

They bond over his book, which leads to a date between Natalie and Marcus... and a deeply romantic relationship full of rich highs and lows, though with an unexpected ending.

Directed by Giacomo Gex and written by Shai Frumkin and Kyvon Edwin -- who also plays the co-lead roles of Natalie and Marcus, respectively -- this romantic short has a tenderness and delicacy, full of the small, intimate details that make up a relationship. Told with a muted urban naturalism in the visual style, the storytelling takes time to build up Natalie and Marcus's "meet cute" on a crowded subway train, as she looks up and sees someone who will turn out to be the man of her dreams. The content of their initial conversation may be the subject of Marcus's book, but the subtext is mutual intrigue and attraction.

That attraction blossoms into a richly realized relationship, whose fleeting but key moments and details are woven together in a lovely, well-crafted montage. As Natalie and Marcus, Frumkin and Edwin have an easy, charming rapport, capturing both the hopeful, flirtatious spark at the relationship's beginning and the more settled, lived-in moments of deep contentment as their love develops. There are conflicts and tension, but overall, the vibe is one of two people deeply in love, making a life together that blossoms into mutual commitment.

The film's biggest accomplishment may be evoking the fullness and depth of this relationship in such a compressed time, showing the poetry and romance of an ordinary life together, full of memories, revelations, arguments, shared meals, sleeping in and having a family. Companionship, sharing a home and family, intimacy, being there for someone through it all, thorns and all: we understand how much it enriches existence, giving both comfort and meaning for Natalie and Marcus and making us care about their fate. But true to the multiple meanings of its title, CRUSH has some tricks up its sleeve. And as it unfurls, it provokes questions of our phone- and tech-saturated society. This is nothing new for a growing number of films, but what CRUSH does well is underscoring what's at stake when we don't look up from our little screens -- and miss those fleeting but key moments that make up the course of a fully realized life.

title: Sci-Fi Short Film "Quantum Love" | DUST
description:
Subscribe and watch more sci-fi shorts on DUST: http://bit.ly/2aqc5vh

A really small love story. But it can still hold an atom together.

"Quantum Love" by Matic Grgic

Director's Statement:
"I imagined the quantum world as an infinitely miniaturized version of our own world. But since life in the realm of subatomic particles must have existed for almost as long as universe itself, or at least, way longer than our own, then it must be old. So, I decided to make the abstract quantum world a bit more real and mix it with some old-looking, gritty and decaying cyber technology – which is still way beyond our reach and understanding. Sort of like a quantum cyberpunk world." - Matic Grgic

Director's Links:
http://www.maticgrgic.com
http://vimeo.com/268394198

title: Horror Short Film "Leopard Heels" | ALTER | Online Premiere
description:
Subscribe to ALTER on YouTube: https://goo.gl/LnXRC3

A job interview turns sinister when misogyny and malice constrict around Renée Hart. Is it a career opening, or the venomous jaws of a trap? 

"Leopard Heels" by Chris Turner

#ALTER #horror #shortfilm

Connect with the Filmmakers: 
https://favouritecolourblack.co.uk/
https://www.instagram.com/favcolblk
https://twitter.com/favcolblk
https://twitter.com/Girl_inthe_Cafe
https://directorsnotes.com/2022/10/04/bolton-2022-best-shorts/

More About "Leopard Heels":  
When Renée Hart attends an interview at the sinister & SON company, things immediately begin to get strange. The receptionist is - in turn - friendly and antagonistic, the long corridors of the office are bland and repetitive, and the staff are unhelpful. 

When she finally meets her prospective new boss Anton, he's an odd mix of hapless and lecherous, and despite Renée's best efforts, the interview doesn't go well. She soon finds herself trying to escape the building, but things have changed since she arrived, and the labyrinthine corridors have become decrepit and dark. 

Something odd is going on at & SON, and Renée would rather not hang around to see what the company's plans for her unfold.

title: HAPPY VALENTINE'S DAY | Omeleto
description:
Two strangers fall in love.


HAPPY VALENTINE'S DAY is used with permission from Neymarc Brothers. Learn more at https://neymarcvisuals.com.


Two strangers meet and fall in love in an instant. But that wonderful moment has its own origin story -- one filled with loss, sadness and tragedy.

This short drama's grand themes of interconnection, love and tragedy aren't just communicated through the film's story -- the Neymarc Brothers's remarkable craftsmanship go a long way to unravel the architecture of a single moment through one ambitious shot: a slow motion reverse "one-r," composed entirely through CGI and other special effects.

The directors and producers shot the film entirely in a custom 360 green screen, carefully choreographing camera movements with actors and marshaling light and wind rigs, artificial rain and stunt pulleys -- and all with moderate resources.

By applying the visual language of blockbusters to the small, intimate story of falling in love, the film creates an emotional and philosophical resonance, exposing the epic scale behind some of the most personal, intimate moments of our lives. The result is an unforgettable cinematic journey that will make you look at your own experience in a new light.

title: CGI **Award-Winning** 3D Animated Short : "I M POSSIBLE" - by Prasad Narse
description:
Check out this heart-warming and moving award-winning 3D animated short called "I M Possible" about match winner "Christopher" after spending a year of his life in a wheelchair because of a disastrous accident, and his determination to play basketball again on his disabled legs. A grueling challenge awaits him on the court!  For more information, please see the details and links below:


DIRECTOR"S STATEMENT
"Nothing is Impossible because the word itself says Im possible" - Audrey Hepburn. How true!   I experienced it through the life of my father, a great sportsman. Though he played Cricket his entire life, he was passionate about all forms of sport. Even after a tragic accident which left his body paralyzed; his passion & love for sports didn"t diminish. Medically his condition was incurable, but still he had the grit to withstand it and wanted to make the impossible, possible. I sensed that it was the sportsman spirit in him which gave him the strength to withstand every adversary. This heart rending experience left me with the desire to unfold my thesis film I M POSSIBLE. I M Possible aims to the audiences who never say die. I hope this film encourages all to explore our passion and give strength to live in any challenging situation.

ORIGINAL MUSIC SCORE
"Destiny Awaits" by Alex Previty

WEBSITE
http://prasadnarse.wix.com/i-m-possiblethefilm

title: **Award Winning** Sci-Fi Short Film: "Clarity" - by Dustin Brown | TheCGBros
description:
TheCGBros Presents "Clarity" by Dustin Brown - A story of obsession, power, and discovery centering around a maverick neuroscientist, her doting pupil, and an alluring machine that could revolutionize brain science.

When maverick neuroscientist Dr. Ana Brenner unexpectedly loses her research funding, she is forced to convince her doting pupil Samantha to continue their work in secret. With the help of their alluring machine CLARITY, they continue on an obsessive quest for discovery. Nearing a breakthrough, Samantha realizes her mentor isn’t all that she seems, and Dr. Brenner is forced to make a devastating choice. For more information, please see the details and links below:

Check out this cool sci-fi short thriller called "Strange Thing" as a newly married couple, Kris and Jake, wake up to find a door has appeared in their living room. As the temptation to open the door lingers the couple discusses how to handle this bizarre phenomenon as they discover more about the person they each married. description:
Watch this amazing and insightful behind the scenes breakdown of how Imageworks artists created and destroyed Washington, D.C. in Columbia Pictures" PIXELS. For more information about this video please see the links below.

Website - http://www.imageworks.com/
Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/SonyPicturesImageworks 
Twitter - https://twitter.com/imageworksvfx/
YouTube Channel - http://www.youtube.com/imageworksvfx

About Sony Pictures Imageworks
------------------------------------------------------
Sony Pictures Imageworks is the Academy Award®-winning visual effects and animation unit of Sony Pictures Motion Picture Group known for live-action visual effects, dynamic creature and character animation and all-CG animation. The company, headquartered in Vancouver, B.C., recently completed work on Columbia Pictures’ PIXELS, Clint Eastwood’s feature film AMERICAN SNIPER, Columbia Pictures’ FURY, Marvel Studios’ GUARDIANS OF THE GALAXY and CAPTAIN AMERICA: THE WINTER SOLDIER, the Warner Bros. feature EDGE OF TOMORROW and THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN 2 for Columbia Pictures. Sony Pictures Imageworks is currently in production on the ANGRY BIRDS movie for Rovio, Disney’s ALICE IN WONDERLAND: THROUGH THE LOOKING GLASS, the Warner Bros. live-action feature SUICIDE SQUAD and STORKS for Warner Bros. Animation. The company is also working on the animated features HOTEL TRANSYLVANIA 2 and the UNTITLED SMURFS MOVIE (working title) for Sony Pictures Animation. Other notable work includes, Disney’s OZ THE GREAT AND POWERFUL, THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN, MEN IN BLACK 3, Sony Pictures Animation’s CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS 2 and HOTEL TRANSYLVANIA as well as Disney’s ALICE IN WONDERLAND.
